reviewTitle: Love them, easy to use & work great!
reviewDescription: I originally got the Gen 3 since they were a newer model but I hated the fit on my ears. They always fell out and just didn’t work. Went and tried these at the Apple Store and they fit like a globe on my ears. They don’t follow out and the functinoallity on all other apple devices is unmatched. They sound great as well honestly no difference between these and the Gen 3. So save your money and get these.

Taking the Apple AirPods at face value, they're a solid headset for the money! If you already have the original, first generation AirPods and just want to upgrade, not a bad option either. The 2nd generation AirPods feature an improved software chip & runs off of BlueTooth 5.0 vs 4.1 (Gen 1). The software chip allows a faster, stronger, and more stable connection with your device(s). This particular item for $139.00 does NOT feature the wireless charging case. This one must be plugged in via USB (cable provided in the box) to an outlet or USB port. The wireless charging case model is $169. Now if you're looking to upgrade to the wireless charging case later on, you can. Apple does sell it separately. If you want the wireless charging option right out of the box, I recommend sending the $169 vs the $139 product here.Sound quality: Straight out of the box, sound is pretty solid. No crackles, static, pops, or any abnormal noises created by the more economic-friendly headsets. You have a lot more adjustability & tuning capabilities if paired on an iOS/Apple device vs using for example paired with an Android OS device. So, ultimately Apple users may or may not get a better sound quality experience.Noise cancellation: AirPods do fit fairly well in the ear without having to be jammed inside your ear canal. Generally they create a snug fit using Apple's "universal" earphone design, it is one size fits most not one size fits all. Some users have upgraded or opted to spend the additional funds on a set of AirPods Pro due to the rubber tips for a better/snug fit. I believe only the AirPods Pro currently has an active noise cancellation utilizing two microphones but I would double-check Apple for accurate information. Also, for Android users. The Galaxy buds by Samsung feature active noise cancellation & wireless charging case on every model so you might want to look into that product before making a final purchase.Battery life: For optimal battery life, I highly recommend charging both AirPods inside the case. The case itself is a battery pack with a life. So if one or both AirPods are low on battery, you can toss them in the case and charge them up. Apple I believe rates 5 minutes of charging time is equivalent to 1 hour of talk/listening time and 15 minutes of charging time is equivalent to 2 hours of talk/listening. I'm sure this is accurate when they're brand new but I'm sure like anything, normal ware & tare might diminish that over time.Warranty: Apple provides a 1-year standard manufacturer's warranty on this product. This ONLY covers defects/defaults from the manufacturer. This will NOT cover physical and/or liquid damages to AirPods, case, or charging cable included.AppleCare: It's $29.00 and 2 years and well worth the extra money. You're already spending this kind of money on a headset, may as well have protection. We get it, accidents happen! But protect yourself and get your AirPods repaired/replaced at no additional cost to YOU! There is no additional fees or deductibles involved.AppleCare tips:You don't have to install AppleCare right away. You have 60 days from the original purchase date to contact Apple by providing your AirPods serial number (on outside of the box) and Apple will tell you if you're still eligible.You can renew AppleCare for another 2 years for the same fee of $29.00 provided you want to keep the same product. If you decide to upgrade to the AirPods Pro or whatever the latest model is, you would have to purchase AppleCare for that specific product.You can go into an Apple store location and get live repair/replacement on your AirPods.Using AirPods with Android:Apple has allowed Android and other non-iOS devices to use AirPods since the AirPods pair/connect via BlueTooth.If you're using AirPods on an Android platform such as Samsung or LG for example there's 2 ways to pair the headset to your device. You either turn on BlueTooth on your device, pop both AirPods inside your ear, find "AirPods" under available connections, and connect. Or you might have to pair manually using the button on the AirPods case to make available, pair, and connect.FAIR WARNING:You will NOT have access to all features that the AirPods have to offer on an Apple/iOS device. You will be limited on functions you can perform.I was able to find an app on Google play store for $1.99 called "AirPopUp". It is a paid application that unlock access to certain/more features of the AirPods similar to what an Apple/iOS device would be granted. Be aware that you will NOT have access nor the ability to have every single feature since you're not on Apple's network. There may be other apps (most likely paid applications) you'd have to find that may unlock more features such as: AirPods battery life percentage, case battery life percentage, programming LEFT & RIGHT AirPods for certain function(s), skipping/pausing/resetting songs, answer/decline/hang up phone calls, find my AirPods, and more.For Samsung users specifically, you might want to look into the Galaxy Buds. They're a little cheaper than AirPods, I believe Amazon has them for $109.99 + $22 3-Year insurance through Assurion that does cover physical/liquid/accidental damage just like AirPods.Galaxy Buds features:Made by SamsungAudio powered by AKGRubber ear bud tipsPair with Samsung device to get the mostWireless charging caseActive noise cancellationComes in multiple colors (black/white/silver/yellow/red & black combo with Star Wars edition Galaxy Note 10+)Includes changing cord and replacement rubber earbud tips.I know if you pair the Galaxy Buds with a Samsung device it will automatically download an application titled "Galaxy Wearable". This allows users to check battery life status of the case and each bud, prompts you for software updates, ability to program LEFT & RIGHT earbuds to do certain function(s), answer/decline/hang up phone calls, pause/skip/reset songs.Apple may charge a lot of money for their products on accessories but they never fall short of being a revolutionary, well-designed, reliable product that works as advertised.

reviewTitle: A Solid Pair of Wireless Earbuds
reviewDescription: The Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) are a popular choice for wireless earbuds, and they come with a Lightning charging case that offers a convenient way to charge and store them. Here's a detailed review based on my experience:Sound Quality (4/5):The sound quality of these earbuds is generally good. They deliver clear and well-balanced audio, making them suitable for a wide range of music genres and audio content. However, some audiophiles may find that they lack the depth and richness found in higher-end headphones.Wireless Connectivity (5/5):Apple has always excelled in creating seamless wireless connections, and the AirPods are no exception. The pairing process is incredibly easy, and they seamlessly connect to your Apple devices via Bluetooth. The connection remains stable, and you can switch between devices effortlessly.Comfort and Fit (4/5):The AirPods are designed to be comfortable for extended use. They're lightweight and fit snugly in most ears. However, some users might find them a bit loose during intense physical activities or while running.Battery Life (4/5):The included Lightning charging case offers an additional 24 hours of battery life, making it easy to keep the earbuds powered up throughout the day. While this is a decent battery life, there are other models on the market that offer even longer playtime.Charging (4/5):The Lightning connector is both a pro and a con. It's convenient if you already own Apple devices, but it's limiting if you use other devices with different charging ports. It would be great to have USB-C compatibility for broader appeal.Voice Assistant Integration (5/5):The AirPods have excellent voice assistant integration with Siri, making it effortless to control your music, check the weather, or send messages with just your voice.Price (3/5):The AirPods are on the higher end of the price range for wireless earbuds. While they offer a great experience, some users might find more affordable options with similar features from other brands.Overall (4/5):The Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) are a solid choice for those in the Apple ecosystem who want reliable wireless earbuds with seamless connectivity and good sound quality. They are comfortable for daily use and come with a convenient charging case. However, the price may deter budget-conscious shoppers, and the Lightning connector might be inconvenient for non-Apple users. If you're willing to invest in quality wireless earbuds and enjoy the Apple ecosystem, these are a great pick.

Great Apple product for the price.Sound quality is fantastic, connecting is a breeze. The only issue for me personally is the fit. My pods fit and stay in for the most part..but I do find myself adjusting them here and there and they don’t ever feel 100% secure in my ear.

reviewTitle: The sound on these are amazing
reviewDescription: The one thing I do not like is when I am wearing them they will fall out of your ears so you have to be mindful when you are using them and that this model will not allow for using the rubber tips to keep them for falling out.

reviewTitle: Great sound, durability could be better.
reviewDescription: My husband goes through a pair every year. They work great most of the time but occasionally they won’t connect. He uses them pretty hard but I still feel like they should last more than a year. His stop connecting properly and / or the microphone stops working.My daughter and I both use them and have had ours for years and they work well - we don’t use ours as much.

reviewTitle: They work like they are supposed to!
reviewDescription: I love these AirPods they work great the quality is amazing it’s just of the music is to loud people will hear it and that gets annoying at time but other than that they work great and the functions and features it has is great

reviewTitle: First try at airpods, pleasently surprised!
reviewDescription: I bought these a few months back and have waited to review them to give an honest review over time.First thoughts were awesome, I am on my computer a lot and wanted an option other than a headset after wearing a headset all day for work. These fit that need while also being wireless so I could watch in bed or sitting back in my chair.The battery isn't the best but being an older version I expected that. Noise cancellation I don't believe was advertised but they block out a small amount of noise in the background so it is a nice touch.Everyone always says to avoid brand name products, but with electronics on amazon, I believe going name brand is usually best.

Pros: sound is great and feels light but solid. Fits pretty snug, will fall out if you’re shaking your head violently, so no worries. Connectivity to iPhone is insanely good. Connects super fastCons: no noise isolation, which I missHighly recommended

reviewTitle: Connection issue when case itself is not charged.
reviewDescription: Theses are great quality headphones, however, if the charging case is not charged, but the AirPods themselves are, for some odd reason, they will not allow me to connect to my iPhone to take a call. That’s my only complaint, but it’s definitely inconvenient.

reviewTitle: Extremely Disappointed: Apple Product Fails After Just 40 Days
reviewDescription: I am writing this review with great disappointment and frustration regarding my recent experience with an Apple product that stopped working after 40 days of use. I had high expectations for the brand's renowned quality and reliability, but sadly, those expectations were shattered.I purchased this Apple product excitedly and eagerly, believing I was investing in a device that would enhance my productivity and seamlessly integrate into my daily life. However, my hopes were quickly dashed when the product suddenly malfunctioned, rendering it completely inoperable. I followed all recommended usage guidelines, handled the product carefully, and treated it as the valuable investment it was meant to be. So, it is highly concerning that such a reputable brand's device would fail quickly and abruptly.Recognizing the gravity of the situation, I promptly reached out to Apple's customer support, expecting a swift resolution. However, I encountered further disappointment when I met with a lackluster response from their support team. Despite providing all necessary information and evidence of the product's abrupt failure, I was met with delayed responses, unhelpful suggestions, and an overall lack of urgency to rectify the situation.As a consumer who values quality and reliability, this experience has left a bitter taste in my mouth. Not only did the product fail prematurely, but the subsequent customer service experience has added insult to injury. The lack of concern, accountability, and willingness to assist in replacing the faulty product is profoundly disheartening.When investing in a premium brand like Apple, one should expect a higher caliber of quality and customer service. Unfortunately, this experience has exposed a significant gap between expectations and reality. Instead of enjoying a dependable device, I am embroiled in a frustrating and time-consuming process to receive a functional product or suitable resolution.I sincerely hope that Apple takes note of this review and genuinely addresses the concerns of its customers. A 40-day lifespan for a device that should have provided years of reliable service is unacceptable. I implore Apple to uphold its reputation for excellence by rectifying this situation promptly and providing a satisfactory resolution, be it through an immediate replacement or equivalent compensation for the subpar product I received.In conclusion, I am highly disappointed in the Apple product that stopped functioning after 40 days. The failure of the device, coupled with the unsatisfactory customer service experience, has tarnished my perception of the brand. Dottie Kennedy

I have bought two pairs of these AirPods, and both have a failure of the microphone after roughly a year or less, and then it no longer works, in other words, nobody can hear you on the other end of a call or meeting, you can only hear them, you cannot talk to them. I have had two pairs of these replaced under warranty after painstaking troubleshooting with Apple support, and the so called “geniuses” at the Apple Store, the “geniuses” will tell you "I've never heard of this problem before" - don’t you love that, yet it’s on forums. I actually talked with an Apple support agent with my last AirPod warranty replacement, I asked if the support person used iPhone and she said yes, she buys a new one whenever it comes out (trendy Apple folk), so I asked if she had issues with her AirPods, she said she had AirPod2, and AirPod Pro so if she has an issue where one pair is not connecting or the microphone fails, she will switch to the other pair (back and forth) but she inadvertently admitted both have the same issue as my latest 4th pair of pods which the microphone audio quit, nobody can hear me anymore, did the same bs troubleshooting on my own, then call Apple support again, and they make you go into the store and deal with those stupid geniuses; disconnected, reconnected, reset, updated, etc. etc. (time wasted is adding up, time is money). They even suggested to reset my phone, dude!!! Really!?!?My my latest pair is now useless for calls or meetings, they are done, AGAIN, just like the last three pairs. And this is the second issue that starts in less than a year of using them, when you pull them out of the case, only one air pod connects half the time, then you have to take the stupid engineering marvel out of your ear, place it back in the case, pull it out again, and maybe it connected, you might have to do that again until it connects; this happened like clockwork with all four pairs of Apple AirPods. many times when one AirPods fails to connect, I feel like smashing them both and be done with Apple all around, its like malware to drive you nuts. Lastly, do you remember the Keynote advertisement years back for these when they show the guy upside down, and Apple basically stating, these are staying in your ears no matter what, HAHAHHAHA. LIES!!!!!! PURE APPLE LIES!!!!! I have refused to buy anything Apple after all their BS marketing, and product failure realities (I won’t mention any details about the 2022 MacStudio defects or Studio Display issues). These AirPods should be called DudPods, or FailurePods. Don't believe me, order away, but remember these words, when the Apple AirPod failures come for you…

reviewTitle: Apple on Amazon has been ridiculously useless for getting help with defective Airpods
reviewDescription: I purchase a pair of 2nd Gen Airpods from this listing on July 11th, 2023.  I paid $106 after taxes.  They were a gift for my 22 yo daughter since her Airpods she's had for years had finally started giving her trouble and they were outside of the year warranty.When we received them.  She attached them to her iPhone XR, the same phone she used with her old pair of Airpods and the right Airpod died after minutes of use.  She put both the left and right Airpods, in the case, plugged the case in the wall, let them charge for a few hours, tried them again and again the right one died after minutes of use.I told her to try to charge the right one in her old case, she did, her phone showed it was fully charged and it died minutes later.  I told my daughter to contact Apple Support.  We can surmise that since the Airpod had the same issue using the other case that the issue was the Airpod and not the right part of the new charging case.She sent her Airpods in for repair, she sent them in with the box they came in, the white Apple box with the picture of the Airpods on them and they returned them in a generic brown box with a clear cellophane window.  The documentation they included in the package said they could not recreate the issue so she tried them again, charged them in the case using the wall plug and they still would not hold a charge longer than a few minutes.I contacted Apple Support and they told me that I could send them back in for repair and I was like, "Can you please just replace them, they're brand new and we sent them in before and they didn't fix them."  Unbeknownst to me, the Apple warranty only covers repairs even if they are BRAND NEW.  So I returned them to Amazon and bought her a new pair from Walmart since they too were doing the $99 Airpods.The ones I got from Walmart work great, no complaints.  I sent the broken pair back to Amazon and now I'm being told its going to take upwards of 60 days for a refund.  That is freaking ridiculous.  Brian, from the Amazon chat said that was so they could compare serial numbers and blah blah blah.  This wait, is ridiculous, Amazon and Apple.  I am disgusted by this wait time.  I work for a company that uses Amazon for fulfilment and we would NEVER make a customer wait for a refund OR replacement.  SO disappointed.

reviewTitle: They work great for a year, then you have to replace them.
reviewDescription: This is my 2nd pair of AirPods. Both times, they started to not work right after a year. I always take very good care of my stuff, these have always been kept in a dry place and never even been dropped.Recently, this purchase of AirPods, one just decided to stop charging. I tried cleaning the AirPod (using Apple's instructions), cleaning the case, resetting them, connecting the case to the charger, multiple different things. Sometimes it will start charging, and other times it won't. Sometimes it says it's charged, and then dies in the middle of my workout without any warning. I contacted Apple support, and all of their suggestions were things I already tried, and because I'm about 4 months outside of the manufacturer's warranty, I'm basically left with zero options other than to replace them.Even though these actually were the replacement for my last pair that I bought when AirPods first came out, I assumed the last pair must had gotten damaged somehow and just bit the bullet and replaced them. At the time, I was hopeful that the next pair would be better. I won't ever buy another pair of AirPods again, such a waste of money.

Since I purchased these for my daughter I've had nothing but problems. My daughter uses the airpods about 6 - 7 hours a day. After about 4 weeks one side started playing lower than the other. I went to the Apple Store since it was past the return window and found out that they could only give me replacement/refurbished airpods instead of brand new since I bought it through Amazon. They replaced the airpods and not the case. These worked for another 4 weeks and then one side starting playing lower than the other. Again, went to Apple store and this time they replaced both the airpods and case which worked another few weeks then the same issue arose. So far, i've been to the Apple store 5 times in 7 months and the time between visits has now decreased to 2 weeks. One Apple tech suggested I purchase Applecare so they can continue to replace them, which they have been doing without issue but I'm getting tired of going there every few weeks. I can't recommend these unless you barely use them otherwise you'll be living at the Apple store.

reviewTitle: I expected more from Apple than this
reviewDescription: These AirPods are ok but for $99 I expected more from them. They have good sound and they are pretty good for talking on the phone. My husband says he can hear me clearly when he calls me. My problem with them are first, that many times they don’t connect to my Iphone even when it says they’re connected. It takes me a long time to get them to connect sometimes. It’s frustrating. Also, if I remove one from one ear, it disconnects both. I can’t get it to reconnect to the one I still have in my other ear, then it says they’re connected even though they’re not. Secondly, the charging case doesn’t hold much charge for very long. I have to charge the case every day or two. Before I bought these, I’ve bought several pairs of cheap ear buds and I’ve never had problems with them connecting to my phone and I only charged the charging cases once or twice a week. Also, I liked how the cheap ones had power indicator lights on the outside of the cases showing how much charge was left. I hope the newer AirPod models are better. I don’t want to spend a lot of money on junk that doesn’t work. Come on Apple! You can do better than this! Especially if you’re going to charge so much! Can’t you do better that a $27 pair of ear buds?

reviewTitle: Left AirPod Connects, Right AirPod Does Not - A Frustrating Experience
reviewDescription: I recently encountered a maddening issue with my Apple AirPods. While I had enjoyed the convenience and audio quality of these wireless earbuds, a problem arose where only the left AirPod would connect, leaving the right one unresponsive. I still have a warranty left.This issue occurred suddenly and without warning. Despite multiple attempts to reset the AirPods, disconnect and reconnect them, and even update the firmware, the right AirPod remained stubbornly disconnected.This situation is incredibly frustrating, as it severely impacts the overall listening experience. The stereo effect is lost, and the functionality of the AirPods is essentially halved. Considering the premium price of these earbuds, I had expected a more reliable and seamless performance.I reached out to Apple Support for assistance, but after following their troubleshooting steps, the problem persisted. I was left with the disappointing realization that I might need to purchase a replacement right AirPod, which is an added expense I hadn't anticipated.This experience has left me questioning the reliability of Apple's AirPods, and I'm concerned about the longevity of these products. I had taken good care of them, ensuring they were always stored properly in their case and free from any physical damage.In conclusion, the issue of only the left AirPod connecting while the right one remains unresponsive has been a major disappointment. It's a frustrating experience that has made me reconsider the value of these earbuds. If you're considering purchasing AirPods, be aware that this problem may arise, and you might need to invest in costly replacements.

reviewTitle: Reoccurring issues that I never experienced with the older version.
reviewDescription: As I lost my previous pair of EarPods (MMEF2AM/A, ordered in Jul-2018) in the plane, it was an easy choice to purchase a new pair, as I was very happy with my previous version. So, I purchased a new pair early Oct-2019. However, after using the Apple EarPods for almost 2 months, I notice that I am so very disappointed with the quality of the newer model, that I decided to write a review.Notes:-Although I am unhappy with the product itself and not with Amazon, the Amazon Helpdesk advised me to leave a Product Review.-I could find that my previous version is the MMEF2AM/A, while I cannot find a version number with the latest purchase. The Order title was "latest model", so I assume this is a different model.-I never dropped or damaged my EarPods and I use a protective cover over the charger case.-WIth regards to my third point below: I generally put the ears back in the charger case, but occasionally (perhaps once every 50 times I use the ears) put the ears in my side pocket).Main differences with the old version:-It sometimes takes much longer for the ears to connect to my phone (which is the same phone that I used with my previous version). I'd say that 1 out of 10 times I put the ears in, the connection takes about 10 seconds. As I use my EarPods for work-calls, I sometimes miss calls while waiting for the ears to connect. The old EarPods always connected quickly and without problems.-If I put the left ear in earlier than the right ear, the right ear sometimes does not connect (while it is fully charge). I can take the ears out and put them back in, but this doesn't help. The only way to "reset" the ears, is to put the ears back into the charger case, before I put them in my ears. This never happened with the older version.-If I don't put the ears back in the charger case but put them in a pocket, my phone somehow still thinks the ears are connected (probably because they don't move much relatively from each other), which drains both my ears AND my phone. The previous version did not give me this issue whatsoever.-Possibly partly because of the above point, but also in general (at least to my feeling), the ears battery life is much lower. The charger case has no problems, but I honestly have the feeling that my new ears have about half the life of the previous version.Asides of the above, the EarPods work well and have high quality sound, hence I suspect that the item itself is not broken in any way. Instead, I suspect design and/or software flaws.I am very disappointed with this, as none of the above issues ever occurred with my previous version. Initially, I hoped it was both a one-time thing (which it wasn't) and that the flaws came with being "a newer version" and were possibly fixable by software updates, but after using the ears for almost 2 months and seeing the issues reoccur, I wanted to give back this feedback.

reviewTitle: We have been forever changed for the worst.
reviewDescription: I purchased the second generation iPods a few weeks ago. They would not stay in my ears, it didn’t matter if I was sitting completely still, walking slowly down the stairs or down the block, every time I moved my head the slightest bit they came out. So, I read every article I could find to fix this problem. Tried almost all of them. Even the ones that Apple recommended not to try. Nothing helped. Today I had a great experience with them.  I went on a long slow walk and they, of course, fell out immediately. I kept putting them back in.  Then, when the left pod fell out it tumbled down into a sewer drain. I continued my walk without any music and really enjoyed myself.  I realized that as a society, we have forgotten the difference between inside and outside. From people talking on their phones while pushing a baby carriage in the middle of a crowded parking lot, talking or reading texts while crossing the street, to my favorite, talking loudly in an elevator, we all seem to want/expect the same experiences both inside and outside.  Those of us who have/had young children, remember talking to them about using their inside voice and outside voice.  There is a difference and a reason we said that!!  It’s very simple. Inside and outside are DIFFERENT!!  There was a time when you could tell someone was an idiot, they stopped at the bottom of an escalator and started having a conversation.  Now we have completely lost our minds.  By the way, I truly appreciate that new technology has changed our lives for the better.  But, It is our responsibility to respect others,  realize boundaries and not be morons.

I purchased the AirPods in September 2023. They kept losing charge. I believed at the time it was due to the decorative case I purchased. I stopped using the case & still had an issue. Took them to the Apple Store, was told the tech couldn’t find an issue at that moment. He said to screenshot the charging screen & come back. I went back last week & the tech told me the chargers in the case have corrosion on them. The AirPods & the case have never been wet while in my possession. I believe this was a defect before I purchased them. It’s been 5 months and the AirPods don’t work at all. Super disappointing.

reviewTitle: NOT for Gym or Isolated sound
reviewDescription: Airpods 2 (2nd Gen) do NOT block ANY external noise. put them on in public and you'll still clearly hear every outside conversation, noise and ambient music, such as at the Gym...my primary use for earbuds is to ISOLATED what im listening to, to block out terrible 'workout music' and other people talking....these do none of that and i dont really understand all the raving reviews....many mention how 'in ear fitted' buds are uncomfortable and the sound on these is so much better...sure the music sounds great if you're in a quiet place but my $30 knockoff in-ears sound fine while isolating what i WANT to hear - easy choice !hoping for a win on the apple aesthetic upgrade i thought maybe id keep these for calls and the esteemed "easy connectivity" but again, as a person who mostly talks in the car or on speaker i dont really see the need. might have to buck up another $60 for the upgrade that everyone says isnt better....these will likely be returnedPros: i will say the sound quality (if youre listening in a quiet controlled environment) is noticeably better than average. its bright, clear and dynamic...i even tested (outside) an 80s metal tune with an otherwise dull one dimensional mix and these somehow brought out depth and separation to the instruments...on other songs i immediately heard sounds i hadnt before, so i guess this is the Spatial Audio aspect and well, good job there !

reviewTitle: I honestly give up on Airpods
reviewDescription: Bought these but needed them for months now. Wore them for the first time and they started disconnecting. I then go to setting and shut off ear detection. Guess what it was still happening. Then, I realize when they link to my phone the old ones are still under protection and not due to expire for some time. Start a chat with apple and never completed it because I realized I already spoke to them about this exact issue before….Also, just for clarity purposes this is a new phone. There should be no reason that this is happening yet again. I mostly love apple products but as far as these airpods go i’ll never buy them again after seeing I’ve purchased six pairs in 3 years. When they work the sound is amazing I give them that but why is it that certain apps or even a phone call disconnects it kinda defeats the purpose of having them. Also, tired of hitting up customer service for returns, exchanges etc. I don’t have the time to walk to the UPS store everyday or even the store.

Let me start out by saying I am a big Apple fan and treasure their products. Unfortunately, due to some defects I would not buy these again.The goodI found the sound quality far superior to a five year old beats product. The battery life is acceptable and I am a heavy user.The case is a delight as the case serves as a portable charging station. You charge the case which is portable and the ear buds charge from the case.Could be betterThe charging light is on the inside of the case so you have to open the case to see the light. Apple fixed this problem on the generation three version.Value for moneyFor me the value for money was a good proposition. Part of the reason for that comes from the bad point below. I also didn’t see a shattering difference between gen 3 which I also have and these but the gen 3 is way more expensive. I would choose gen three over gen two if they were the same price.The badI can’t keep these in my ear. Because they fall out so easily and you don’t know they are out, i know I will lose the product wearing them around. As a result, I don’t take these phones out of the house. Since you are likely to be replacing them frequently due to loss, it is logical to choose the lesser expensive option.ConclusionIf you are going to buy this product the second generation is a great investment because overall they are a quality product but you will be replacing them frequently.

I bought these a few years ago. From the onset I couldn’t figure how people kept them in their ears without them falling out.Yes, my ears can’t hold them for long. I place them in my ears as directed, then they’ll slowly fall out.I could be in bed, not moving, and they slowly fall out.Every time. Every single time.  It gets old.I don’t understand how people get them to stay, especially runners, and walkers. If I walk around my home, listening to tunes, one will slowly drop out; I’m constantly adjusting their fit so they’ll stay in place.I bought one of those accessory kits where you can add an over the ear holder. It helps, but you can’t charge them with those wings on them. Taking them off to charge, and putting them on to listen gets old. It also wears out the hole that holds the ear wing in place.I can’t wear these anywhere for fear of losing one or both. I wear them only while listening to music in bed.  That’s right in bed, no where else.  But even in bed they can still fall out.The sound is good, great quality, as long as it stays in my ear canal. Then as they slowly disengage with my ear canal, the sound slowly deteriorates. If they both come loose they can disconnect from Bluetooth, when that occurs, the device starts playing the sound, waking up my spouse.They’re also difficult to clean. As I wear them, wax can build up on the ear bud’s speaker. It’s very difficult to remove completely. Cotton swabs can’t clean, can’t pick up all the wax. I’ve tried plastic dental cleaners, plastic picks, and even an unbent paper clip. The paper clip actually worked best.So, three stars overall.

reviewTitle: Not great battery life - dies often

reviewTitle: Can the Anker Soundcore Liberty 2 compete with the Apple AirPods 2 at $40 less?
reviewDescription: Although the 2nd generation AirPods came out in March 2019, improvements are merely incremental. At the $100 price point, can the recently released Anker Soundcore Liberty 2 compete? Read on to learn how the more expensive latest $140 Apple AirPods stack up versus Soundcore Liberty 2 Pro:QUICK SPOILER ANSWER ANKER VS. APPLE AIRPODS:Yes indeed. At $40 less, the Anker boasts equal sounds and noise cancellation not offered by Apple unless upgrading to the $250 Pro model. The Apple AirPod 2 is the perennial best seller in this price range. You won’t be disappointed unless you need the awesome feature of noise cancellation. The $100 Anker is very well spent and does includes noise cancellation and an equalizer to balance the sound to your taste.SOUND QUALITYI specialize in tech reviews and place the far highest priority on listening quality. If it’s better mic quality you are after, or have hearing difficulty, the AirPods are a bit better, capturing more-subtle voice tones. But for music, the Anker equals Apple’s impressive sound. Once you nail the fit, both will impress all but audiophiles in all aspects of sound quality: accuracy, tonal range, non-fatiguing, and punchy (but not annoying) bass.Speaking of bass, Anker does punch it up. The highs are slightly rounded off, the midrange is fairly flat, and the low end is boosted.NOISE CANCELLATION: Apple vs. AnkerThis Apple model has none unless you spring for the newest $250 Pro version. For a lower price, the Anker’s have it, and do a worthy job. This feature alone lets Anker win the race vs. the lastest Apple AirPod. If you haven’t experienced noise cancellation in headphones, or earbuds, you’ll likely be as blown away as I was. I got my first noise cancelation Bose headphones six years ago when they were the only game in town. Life changing, truly. A must for any noisy environment and a godsend for rest on long airplane trips.The Anker’s were my second noise cancelling earbuds, and while not spectacular like the class leading $250 Sony’s, the result is satisfying. I urge you to audition this feature. When making, phone calls, you may prefer it off.CONTROLLING THE SOUND: APPLE VS. THE ANKER EQUALIZER APP:With the Apple AirPods, open Settings, Tap Music, and then EQ under the Playback tab. Although the Soundcore Liberty 2 boosts the bass, some of us prefer a more nuanced and balanced sound. With either of the new Anker’s the app is a terrific add on. You can get the sound balanced to your tastes easily.ADDITIONAL EARBUD REVIEWS COMPARISONS:If tempted to spend another $100 for the Apple AirPods Pro, have a look at my detailed review of the awesome Sony’s compared with the Apple AirPod:https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R3CQKVFI571CDE/ref=cm_cr_getr_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B07T81554HSHOULD YOU SPEND MORE? VALUE AND OVERALL BEST CHOICE:Although only released in December 2016, the “age” of the AirPod technology is showing. If you can spend more, in late 2019 Apple released it’s latest Airpods Pro. At nearly double the price these hit a “whole ‘nuther level” for Apple to compare closely with the extraordinary high end Sony WF-1000XM3 at a similar $250+ price.If you can spend $200+ Sony the new Sheriff in town and in my opinion beats even the newest $250 Apple AirPods. However, at $100, the Anker’s impress and are better than the basic Apple AirPods with one great advantage: noise cancellation. If you don’t like the black color, go with the sleek and now classic $150 Apple model.Thanks for slogging through this long review. Hope it has helped your important buying decision.NOW TIME TO RELAX AND KICK UP THE JAMS!

Taking the Apple AirPods at face value, they're a solid headset for the money! If you already have the original, first generation AirPods and just want to upgrade, not a bad option either. The 2nd generation AirPods feature an improved software chip & runs off of BlueTooth 5.0 vs 4.1 (Gen 1). The software chip allows a faster, stronger, and more stable connection with your device(s). This particular item for $139.00 does NOT feature the wireless charging case. This one must be plugged in via USB (cable provided in the box) to an outlet or USB port. The wireless charging case model is $169. Now if you're looking to upgrade to the wireless charging case later on, you can. Apple does sell it separately. If you want the wireless charging option right out of the box, I recommend sending the $169 vs the $139 product here.Sound quality: Straight out of the box, sound is pretty solid. No crackles, static, pops, or any abnormal noises created by the more economic-friendly headsets. You have a lot more adjustability & tuning capabilities if paired on an iOS/Apple device vs using for example paired with an Android OS device. So, ultimately Apple users may or may not get a better sound quality experience.Noise cancellation: AirPods do fit fairly well in the ear without having to be jammed inside your ear canal. Generally they create a snug fit using Apple's "universal" earphone design, it is one size fits most not one size fits all. Some users have upgraded or opted to spend the additional funds on a set of AirPods Pro due to the rubber tips for a better/snug fit. I believe only the AirPods Pro currently has an active noise cancellation utilizing two microphones but I would double-check Apple for accurate information. Also, for Android users. The Galaxy buds by Samsung feature active noise cancellation & wireless charging case on every model so you might want to look into that product before making a final purchase.Battery life: For optimal battery life, I highly recommend charging both AirPods inside the case. The case itself is a battery pack with a life. So if one or both AirPods are low on battery, you can toss them in the case and charge them up. Apple I believe rates 5 minutes of charging time is equivalent to 1 hour of talk/listening time and 15 minutes of charging time is equivalent to 2 hours of talk/listening. I'm sure this is accurate when they're brand new but I'm sure like anything, normal ware & tare might diminish that over time.Warranty: Apple provides a 1-year standard manufacturer's warranty on this product. This ONLY covers defects/defaults from the manufacturer. This will NOT cover physical and/or liquid damages to AirPods, case, or charging cable included.AppleCare: It's $29.00 and 2 years and well worth the extra money. You're already spending this kind of money on a headset, may as well have protection. We get it, accidents happen! But protect yourself and get your AirPods repaired/replaced at no additional cost to YOU! There is no additional fees or deductibles involved.AppleCare tips:You don't have to install AppleCare right away. You have 60 days from the original purchase date to contact Apple by providing your AirPods serial number (on outside of the box) and Apple will tell you if you're still eligible.You can renew AppleCare for another 2 years for the same fee of $29.00 provided you want to keep the same product. If you decide to upgrade to the AirPods Pro or whatever the latest model is, you would have to purchase AppleCare for that specific product.You can go into an Apple store location and get live repair/replacement on your AirPods.Using AirPods with Android:Apple has allowed Android and other non-iOS devices to use AirPods since the AirPods pair/connect via BlueTooth.If you're using AirPods on an Android platform such as Samsung or LG for example there's 2 ways to pair the headset to your device. You either turn on BlueTooth on your device, pop both AirPods inside your ear, find "AirPods" under available connections, and connect. Or you might have to pair manually using the button on the AirPods case to make available, pair, and connect.FAIR WARNING:You will NOT have access to all features that the AirPods have to offer on an Apple/iOS device. You will be limited on functions you can perform.I was able to find an app on Google play store for $1.99 called "AirPopUp". It is a paid application that unlock access to certain/more features of the AirPods similar to what an Apple/iOS device would be granted. Be aware that you will NOT have access nor the ability to have every single feature since you're not on Apple's network. There may be other apps (most likely paid applications) you'd have to find that may unlock more features such as: AirPods battery life percentage, case battery life percentage, programming LEFT & RIGHT AirPods for certain function(s), skipping/pausing/resetting songs, answer/decline/hang up phone calls, find my AirPods, and more.For Samsung users specifically, you might want to look into the Galaxy Buds. They're a little cheaper than AirPods, I believe Amazon has them for $109.99 + $22 3-Year insurance through Assurion that does cover physical/liquid/accidental damage just like AirPods.Galaxy Buds features:Made by SamsungAudio powered by AKGRubber ear bud tipsPair with Samsung device to get the mostWireless charging caseActive noise cancellationComes in multiple colors (black/white/silver/yellow/red & black combo with Star Wars edition Galaxy Note 10+)Includes changing cord and replacement rubber earbud tips.I know if you pair the Galaxy Buds with a Samsung device it will automatically download an application titled "Galaxy Wearable". This allows users to check battery life status of the case and each bud, prompts you for software updates, ability to program LEFT & RIGHT earbuds to do certain function(s), answer/decline/hang up phone calls, pause/skip/reset songs.Apple may charge a lot of money for their products on accessories but they never fall short of being a revolutionary, well-designed, reliable product that works as advertised.

reviewTitle: Perhaps not the best option for serious runners
reviewDescription: I only use them for running but while doing so there's a few features that I like to have by the quick press of the button/ear bud instead of fumbling for my phone: skip forward, skip back, pause/play, adjust volume and a nice bonus that is rarely used is calling up siri. While you can customize each of the ear buds to perform one of these actions, you can only pick two, and volume adjust is not an option which is a huge problem for me while running at times (i.e. going into and out of traffic areas). The sound quality and battery life is excellent as you'd expect for an apply product but w/o these other capabilities I'm considering returning them because they just won't be used that much and I feel as though the lack of controls will make them annoying. It is nice that they pause automatically when you take them out but sometimes I want a quick tap instead. They also aren't super sensitive so sometimes I double tap and it doesn't do the desired function, then I'm tapping again a little harder. I can't figure out if I'm not hitting it hard enough, quick enough, or the wrong spot. When you're running you really don't want to mess with this too much, it needs to be quick and responsive. I realize this is an earlier generation but not sure why they didn't at least incorporate a single tap and double tap option to provide more features.I was replacing some much cheaper Mifa X17 buds that only lasted about a year before I started having problems and a few months later they might be totally dead for good (at least one of the two buds). But for the price, I could get 3-4 of those for the same price as these, still have pretty good quality sound and all the features I need for running plus it has wireless charging. I mean that's like 3-5 yr of earbuds for the same price with much more features... I'm not sure I can ignore that. Just another option to consider depending on what your intended use is.

The Apple AirPods have received a lot of hype and attention since their release, but unfortunately, they do not live up to the high expectations. One of the most significant issues with the AirPods is their battery life. While Apple claims that the AirPods can last up to five hours on a single charge, many users have reported that they do not even last that long.Furthermore, the charging case that comes with the AirPods only provides an additional 24 hours of battery life, which is not enough for many people who use their AirPods on a regular basis. The charging case is also quite bulky and can be inconvenient to carry around.Another issue with the AirPods is their fit. While some users find them comfortable, others have reported that they fall out of their ears easily or do not fit properly, making them uncomfortable to wear for long periods.Additionally, the sound quality of the AirPods is not as impressive as some other wireless earbuds on the market. Many users have reported that the sound is not as clear or powerful as they would like, and there is no noise-cancellation feature.Overall, while the AirPods may be convenient and stylish, they are not worth the high price tag for many users due to their subpar battery life, fit issues, and mediocre sound quality.

reviewTitle: Definitely worth every penny and then some
reviewDescription: I love my AirPods. I thought about getting the AirPods Pro but I didn’t wanna spend that much more just to have the noise canceling feature. Now I will probably upgrade in a year or two now that they’ve even improved the AirPods Pro even more.Coming from somebody who has an iPad and iPhone and an iMac at home having the AirPods and the ability to Switch between them so effortlessly without having to unpair and repair is so nice.I’ve had a number of Bluetooth headsets over the years from Plantronics to generic to a number of other different companies I don’t even know if I could remember every different manufacture that I’ve had. I always hated that they were bulky they never fit in my ear just right. I just never felt like they were great and it was always complicated they seem to fuss to pair up and especially if they ever unpaired then it was starting all over again. I love that the minute that I got my AirPods I flipped open the case and right away my iPhone registers that they are there and with the top of a Button on my phone and the top of the button on the AirPods in a couple of seconds I am paired up.I also have a very nice charger that I bought right here on Amazon for about $25 and it will charge my Apple Pencil my AirPods my Apple Watch and my iPhone all at the same time which is amazing and so nice that I can just click my AirPods case on there and they charge up in a very short time.First off I’m not a sound engineer or an audio file so I can’t say that they have the absolute best sound quality and I’m sure that they don’t I can’t imagine that if you went out and got some of the beads or some other type of wireless headset that fits over your entire ear with a bigger driver in it that of course it’s going to have better sound quality.But I love that they are tiny small and easy to just throw in the case. The battery life is great if my case is fully charged with the AirPods in and charged I can go to complete times to almost dead with both AirPods being used. If I only use one way talking on the phone I can go even more so in between case charging times is sometimes over a week which is absolutely amazing. The talk time on them is very long as well. I’ve never sat down and figured up exactly whether I get the exact time that Apple says.I love that the minute that I put them in my ear I get a nice little tone to let me know that they’ve connected if I’m listening to music and I take them out it automatically pauses. I love that it will even pause my music if I get an iMessage and it will read my message it will tell me who it’s from if they’re in my contact list if not it will read me the phone number and then read me the message and then asked me if I would like to respond all without touching my phone.I love Apple products even if they are a little more expensive in some areas but I love that for instance with the AirPods home they tie Effortlessly Into my phone my Mac and my iPad.I absolutely hate when I am talking on the phone for more than a couple of minutes to have to hold the phone. Also I run a business and so I have to multitask sometimes someone calls and I need to be able to pick up a remote to navigate to something to check I may need to grab the computer etc. and having the ability to have both hands free to do something like that while still talking and not worrying about the AirPods falling out of my ear is worth more than the money that I paid for them by far and then all the other features that come with it are great.So in the end I think that they are amazing and I’ve had it again a number of different Bluetooth headsets and they never fit right they fall out of my ear or the ones that took over my ears are always so uncomfortable after a short period of time that I never ended up using them I always ended up using my wired earbuds that come with my iPhone.

reviewTitle: Wireless Freedom and Crystal-Clear Sound - Apple AirPods 2nd Gen Redefine the Earbud Experience
reviewDescription: The Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) are a game-changer in the world of wireless earbuds, offering a seamless and immersive audio experience that sets a new standard for convenience and sound quality. With their intelligent design, easy setup, and exceptional performance, these earbuds are a must-have accessory for anyone seeking unparalleled audio freedom.The standout feature of the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) is their effortless wireless connectivity. With the proprietary Apple H1 chip, pairing the AirPods with your iPhone, iPad, or Apple Watch is a breeze. The moment you open the case, the AirPods automatically connect to your device, allowing you to enjoy your favorite music, podcasts, and calls instantly. The seamless transition between devices ensures a hassle-free and uninterrupted listening experience.The AirPods deliver crystal-clear sound quality that elevates your music and audio content. With custom-designed drivers and enhanced bass response, the earbuds produce rich, full-bodied sound that captivates your senses. Whether you're listening to your favorite tunes, watching movies, or making phone calls, the AirPods deliver impeccable sound that immerses you in the moment.The AirPods are designed to adapt to your needs. Thanks to built-in optical sensors and motion accelerometers, the earbuds know when they are in your ears and automatically pause playback when you remove them. This smart feature not only saves battery life but also ensures that you never miss a beat when you need to take a break from listening.Apple's signature Siri voice assistant is seamlessly integrated into the AirPods. With just a double-tap, you can activate Siri to control your music, make calls, check the weather, and more, all without needing to take out your iPhone. The hands-free operation adds convenience to your daily routine and allows you to stay connected and informed while on the go.The AirPods' charging case provides extended battery life, ensuring that your earbuds are always ready to use. With up to 5 hours of listening time and more than 24 hours of total battery life when using the charging case, you can enjoy your favorite audio content throughout the day without worrying about running out of power.The sleek and minimalistic design of the AirPods complements any style. The earbuds fit comfortably in your ears and stay securely in place, making them suitable for all-day wear. Additionally, the AirPods are sweat and water-resistant, making them ideal for workouts and outdoor activities.In conclusion, the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) redefine the earbud experience, offering a perfect blend of convenience, sound quality, and intelligent features. With effortless wireless connectivity, crystal-clear sound, and seamless integration with Siri, these earbuds provide a truly immersive and enjoyable audio experience. Whether you're a music lover, podcast enthusiast, or simply seeking a reliable hands-free accessory, the AirPods are the epitome of wireless earbuds done right. Experience the freedom of wireless audio with the Apple AirPods and elevate your listening experience to new heights.
My dog chewed my other set and bought this one. Reasonable price knowing it comes from Apple. Love the sound quality but not durable to dog bites :(

Was afraid they’d fall out of my ears but that’s not a problem either, great purchase!

reviewTitle: Apple kept my defected AirPods and did not refund
reviewDescription: I bought them march 15,2023. I reached out to apple and they sent a prepaid labeled box to ship them back. I received the box 4-28/23 I mailed it out through ups as told May 1, 2023. Some how Nevada received them the same day I shipped them out of texas. They told me I have a 4 year old serial number, and my tracking number was invalid. They did not reimburse me. They did not send a new pair even though I have 9 months left before that expires, but the worst and yet funny part is they won’t return them defected either. And they hung up after 3 years. I’ve been an apple customer since the first one came out. I’m begging you all, do not purchase anything from apple from Amazon: Amazon did amazing at helping me solve this. Apple robbed me. I can’t help but laugh: never have I returned something under warranty and not get a new product much less not getting the one I sent in. Please please, do not trust apple through other platforms.

reviewTitle: One airpod works and only one will connect at a time
reviewDescription: I bought these as a graduation present for when I graduated college and I won't be buying airpods again. Initially when I bought them they worked fine for 5 months, outside of the return window of course. When I started having issues, such as only one working at a time or both just plain not playing audio, I took them to the apple store to see what's up. They took the airpods and returned them to me three days later claiming that the left airpod wasn't connecting. The moment they came in the mail I tried them on and played a song. And what a surprise, only the right airpod was playing and with no change in my problem. So I took them back, where apple told me that that both airpods connect and that they can't do anything unless they fail to connect. Wonderful news being essentially nothing could be done, especially when they already have my money for a jank/faulty product. They directed me to discuss with amazon about the issue. It falls outside of the return window so whatever, and none of the troubleshooting options provided worked. Don't buy, because if you run into issues similar to mine you're SOL. I will be investing my money in other headphones, not apple brand. All in all, these suck.

reviewTitle: Beware - 1year Mfr Warranty from Apple will not apply!
reviewDescription: The case for these AirPods stopped charging after only having them for 6 months. (Barely even used since Bluetooth headphones have not been proven safe).Apple products are supposed to have a “limited one year warranty” regardless if you purchase the additional Apple Care coverage.But apparently, Apple only honors the 1 year from date of purchase IF you purchase through Apple. If you purchase through Amazon, they start the 1 year warranty on the date Amazon makes the purchase from them! So if amazon has an Apple product for a year (or more) before you buy it…you will not have ANY warranty on that item.Also, according to Apple, these particular AirPods were USED - showing a purchase date 2 years before my purchase date. So of course, Apple stated the item was out of warranty and refused to repair/replace the AirPods.There is NO explanation of this warranty issue on Amazon’s Apple listings.So, until Amazon & Apple correct this warranty FAILURE, please consider purchasing your Apple products through Apple Store only. Or make sure the warranty date is valid, or purchase the extended coverage.*** Apple products have an uncanny ability to stop working just days after the warranties are up….

reviewTitle: Low quality break easily on their own
reviewDescription: On my 3rd pair of these and the right ear got quiet after only 2 months I don’t drop them or get them wet. They are really comfortable and easy to pair to your phone but I’m done with them $100 to not even make it 60 days is a joke

Let me start by saying our family buys lots of Apple products. Add that with the fact that having wireless earbuds are so convenient and Apple appears to makes a slick product. The airpods fit fine for me and my spouse. The case is also very small, but the earbuds could have smaller stems. The sound quality is good, but not excellent. However, both sets we purchased had one earbud die within 1.5 years. I talked with a friend and they said the same thing happened to them. Combine that with some negatives such as the high price, average battery life, the fact that these aren’t noise canceling, the annoyance that having a family sharing apple account combines all earbuds into everyones devices causing a lot of accidental switching of airplay, and you have a very expensive recurring cost per year per person. I thought about how a warranty might help, but you still have to pay for warranty plus the replacement parts and can only replace 2 parts. Buying a new pair would have ended up being the same cost for us or even cheaper with the airpods on sale. Maybe the gen 3’s will be more reliable but I’m not paying almost $200 to find out. My advice for most people, buy the off brands that come with an 18 month warranty and more features like double the battery life and controls. They will run as low as $30 and will probably be good enough. You can reward yourself with a music subscription using the money you’ll save.

The product itself was fine. However, when we returned it because it didn’t work for us it’s taking them a month to refund my money. They wanted payment right away, but then won’t give you your money back for a month after they receive the product. not right at all.

From the moment I opened them the hinge was loose, the AirPods seemed ok, but the left ear is very quite now, the right ear started to do it but randomly came back. The charger included doesn’t work unless twisted. The case charges but the AirPods don’t and last maybe 40mins. These are advertised as new so I would expect this if refurbished. I had an exact pair for 3 years and only had to get new ones because my dog ate one, and the other just got really dirty. So for a month worth of use this is a bad product.I am a person that looks at all reviews with a grain of salt so I’m telling you with honesty it’s not worth it. Thank you for reading

reviewTitle: DEFECTIVE, Does not work more than 1 month
reviewDescription: Worked ok for one month then the charging case suddenly completely stopped working. The charging light never turns green and it doesn’t light up when AirPods are inserted. reviewTitle: Battery of right earbud failed immediately
reviewDescription: I am *so* dissatisfied with my purchase of these and I am returning them. I had a pair of refurbished airpods 2nd gen and the right earbud never held it's charge for more than about an hour. The shape of the 2nd gen. work well for my ears (unpopular opinion, I know), so I wanted to get a brand new pair. Truly, right out of the box, the battery of the right earbud failed to keep a charge. After charging them for hours in the case and with the charger, the right airbud was at 1% and then 0% charge within minutes. I reached out to Apple Support, and the person instructed me to do a factory reset, which I did. The fix lasted all of 10 minutes and then lost all the charge again. I have looked at a variety of online forums and have tried all recommended fixes and nothing has worked. I have tried the factory reset about 10 times now and it never works for more than a few minutes. I was really hoping this BRAND NEW pair of Airpods was going to work, but nope--I'm done with AirPods for good. I have now ordered a pair of JBL's for $40 less and I have no doubt I will be so much happier with these--because I assume they'll actually work! What a total disappointment.

reviewTitle: Right Air Pod Doesn’t Charge Properly
reviewDescription: The second generation Air Pods are great wireless headphones however the ones purchased through Amazon, which are a few dollars cheaper than if you were to buy from Apple, do not charge properly. Every day I need to double check if the right Air Pod was charged and the issue arose 1 month after the purchase, which conveniently was past the time for product return. I’d recommend to get this Air Pods directly from Apple.

reviewTitle: Stopped working after a week, Apple gave us a hard time about exchanging them
reviewDescription: We bought a brand new set of AirPods for $159. After using them for a week, I was listening to them and the right air pod went dead. I figured, maybe I just need to charge them. So when I got home I charged them, and the next day I went to use them again and the right air bud was still dead. So I did some research, tried to reset them, and then I couldn't reconnect them to my phone at all.Once I contacted Apple, they tried to give us the run around. They wanted us to let them fully die, which makes sense, so we did that. Then, when they still didn't work we wanted to exchange the faulty pair for a new set (BECAUSE WE PAID 159 DOLLARS AND ONLY USED THEM FOR A WEEK). Keep in mind, they were taken care of, not dropped, no water damage, they were expensive so they were treated delicately.  Apple wanted a $180 deposit to get a new set, which is MORE THAN WHAT I ORIGINALLY PAID FOR.I decided to contact Amazon, and they suggested contacting Apple, but once I explained what was going, on Amazon offered to make things right and send out a replacement. Never had an issue with Amazon's customer service, but Apple was extremely disappointing. I won't purchase these again.

reviewDescription: Agent at Amazon said that it would be replaced after we had gone through all the steps to see if was indeed the charging case that was defective. Realld disappointment with them. Never buy an apple product from Amazon.
These AirPods Don’t stay charged long. The individual AirPods doesn’t hold a long charge after 4 hours they die. DISAPPOINTED

It has been quite a while since I've bought a set of Apple earbuds to use as my primary form of listen-wear. I truly miss the design of the Apple earbuds from the pre-2010 iPod days. I used the heck out of them as a kid, and thought the 2nd generation AirPods would hopefully be the closest thing to that. For me, they aren't...Sound quality is as good as I always thought the Apple headphones were, nothing really lost there.Battery life is fantastic, though admittedly, I haven't really charged them since I initially charged them when I first got them and it's been several days (not continuous use)...so...take that for what it's worth...Comfort is the absolute biggest miss here. You have to shove these things down into your ear to get optimal hearing and my ears are not a fan of that. If you look up the external parts of the ear, the "Helix Crus" part of my outer ear is so irritated that once I take the AirPods out, there's no way they are going back in. (So just leave them in then)....well...that's not always possible, and because they hurt so much, I find myself trying to adjust to make them more comfortable, and that just doesn't work.(So get some earbud cushions....) Got 'em...I got a whole pack of 20 or so from Amazon that people were adamant would make the AirPods more comfortable based on their own experience......didn't work. You could say in some regard that they helped to some degree, but they definitely didn't take away the uncomfortability of the  AirPods, and if it doesn't eliminate the comfort issue completely, they might as well not even be there...(Could it just be your ears....?) YES, it absolutely could just be MY ears. Ears come in all different sizes and some may not even notice these things are in their ears - that's what I was hoping for...but sadly didn't achieve. Perhaps if there was a smaller pair, the discomfort may not be such a problem, but obviously that's illogical.I also had an issue with getting the sound to play on them from my phone. Bluetooth was enabled, Airpods were showing as "Connected", but the sound wouldn't switch from my phone speaker to the AirPods. I can't remember what all I had to do in order to finagle that....but it took some doing, and no other non-Apple product that I've ever used has had this issue...and if you research it, it sounds like it's a common issue with no real straight-forward resolution.It's truly a shame. I could have done with lesser quality sound and even poorer battery life in exchange for greater comfort. Apple hits the mark on just about everything here except that one VERY important aspect, so buy at your own risk. I probably won't be using these the way that I thought I was going to be because of it...  $100 down...

I initially loved my AirPods for their sleek design and impressive sound quality. However, I'm disappointed to report that despite my careful handling – no drops or accidental stomps – they developed cracks. It's frustrating when a product with such a premium reputation falls short on durability. I hope the issue is addressed for future users, as it has impacted my overall satisfaction with an otherwise great product.

I'm fully in the Apple Ecosystem: iPhone, iPad, Mac. It was time to replace my wireless headphones and heard so much about the Airpods and so many friends love them, decided to stay Apple.  Indeed Airpods work great with Apple products. If that's all you're going to use them for, don't hesitate. I've bought and returned 3 other airbud products. Primary issue was the device staying in the ear, then sound quality.  Airpods stay in your ears and the sound is very good for the price point.HOWEVER........I'm primarily interested in wireless help with hearing especially my TVs.  I do not have Apple TV. One TV is a smart Samsung with Bluetooth and the other is Panasonic that I've added a Bluetooth transmitter.  Anything that's not Apple has no issue pairing with the TVs.  When it comes to pairing the Airpods, my blood pressure rises each time. Sometimes they pair, sometimes not.  But that's not the real issue.  The Airpods do not have independent sound control. If you're using an Apple device, you control the sound through the device like phone, watch etc.  However, my TVs (two major brands) do not have volume control for output. Very few TVs do.  So if the volume is too high or too low, I need to disconnect from the TV, pair with an Apple device, get the volume where I think I want it, then disconnect, then re-pair with the TV and hope the volume is somewhere near where I like it.I spoke with Apple about this and their response is buy an Apple TV device. That way the Airpod will pair and sound can be controlled. In my case, I would need to buy 2 Apple TV devices.  The low priced airbuds come with volume control, apparently there isn't any technology magic required.  Apple is choosing to not include.I'm still undecided about returning the Airpods. The fit, comfort and sound are well worth the price. The volume annoyance is a reminder each time I use these things that Apple is not the customer focused/design company we think they are.  Before I bought the Airpods, I spoke with 3 friends who use and highly recommend.  Each one told me I would be able to control the volume with my iPhone or iPad. After talking with Apple, that is not the case.While on that subject, since my last Apple purchase this is the first time in about 18 months that I've needed to talk with Apple support.  What has happened over there?  Four calls in two weeks; each time I feel like I'm speaking with someone that is just reading a script and doesn't really understand the issue.  The solution to most any issue seems to be, buy something else Apple.  As a long time shareholder who's gone through a lot of stock splits, I appreciate the focus on Apple products but come on, there's more solutions to improving an Apple product than buying another Apple product.

reviewTitle: Very disappointed in the battery life.
reviewDescription: I had the originals when they came out and I used them until they just could not be charged any longer.  So in ordering this version of them I had great hopes, but I feel as if the battery life is not very good in these Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds.

reviewTitle: slips out of my ears so fast even while I am not moving
reviewDescription: I like the quality of Apple products. I wanted to upgrade from my first generation pods which have been around my home for many years and have been used on a daily basis. I am very happy with the connectivity to different connected devices back and forth. Battery life is not an issue for me since the charging case can always be plugged.  BUT, and this is a big BUT, this one slips out of ear so easily within minutes.  I did look up the reviews before buying this on sale for $79. Most reviewers said they dont have the issue while some reviewers faced the issue I am currently having. At least, with the first generation, silicone tips were somewhat helpful to make them stay in my ears for a while and provided a decent noise cancellation because of that. This one does not have the silicon tips, and has a weird design that wont fit my ears or my wife's ears.  May be I am one of those outside the bell curve for the ear fit with these Airpods. I am never going to buy these airpods again. Some times, i dont feel like using over the head earphones and wanted these ones to really work out for me. But unfortunately, i have to still resort to the over the ear headphones (which obviously provide better sound quality and great noise cancellation- i know it is not an apple to apple comparison). I currently have Bose QC35 (using for many years) and sony-WH1000XM3 (using since a year or so) that are far superior than this.  At a local store I tried some sports headphones (around the ear) called SHOKZ that actually is better than this Airpod because it goes around your ear and connected behind your neck. I will be returning this today!

My little 7 year old nephew wanted the first generation airpod for his birthday but his parents thought they were a waste of money, so I got them for him behind his parents' backs and he loves them.They operated well until approximately a month ago. At that point, the right earbud microphone started to malfunction and would no longer detect sound until he yelled. I phoned Apple customer service and went over all of the possible remedies, such as upgrading to the most recent iOS and checking that the AirPods were running the most recent firmware. When customer service was unable to remedy the issue, they advised me to send the AirPods in for repair. I received a FedEx shipment box and label and made them an offer for repair. The AirPods were returned to me approximately three days later, along with a message from the technicians claiming that there was nothing wrong with them.I then tested them on my phone and my wife's phone, and the right microphone on both phones would only detect sound at a very high volume, but the sound was still garbled. I phoned Apple's customer service department once more. The representative advised that I take the AirPods to the local Apple Store and explain the problem to a professional there. Unfortunately, the nearest Apple Store was an hour away from my house, however the agent did not appear to find this to be an issue.I expressed my unhappiness with having to drive 2 hours round trip to fix a $130 equipment, and I inquired as to why I couldn't send them back for repair while determining the specific problem. The agent agreed to send another shipping box and note that the problem was with the right microphone on the repair ticket. I got another package, sent the AirPods in for repair a second time, and waited. They gave them back to me and said there was nothing wrong with them. And, once again, the right microphone isn't working properly.At this point, I'm left wondering why the "World's Most Valuable Company" would consider it appropriate to force a client to spend 3 hours of my time repairing Apple's product rather than just shipping a new pair and keeping the consumer satisfied. Apple's customer service has tarnished what might have been a fantastic device.

AirPods are definitely very convenient to use, especially if you like to listen to music or videos while you’re working/moving around. Sound quality is standard and pretty much the same as the wired earbuds. The battery life is really good and you could listen for the entire day relatively uninterrupted if you use one AirPod and swap when the battery runs low. Even when I don’t use them for several days, the battery doesn’t drain so they can last a long while if you leave them around. However, there’s a frustrating issue that I’ve encountered more times than should be acceptable for rather highly priced earbuds. This is mostly relevant if you tend to only use one earbud at a time though; it’s not a major issue if you normally use both at the same time.The first pair I ordered came brand new and sealed, but within a few hours, they had already stopped working properly. The right AirPod would not connect unless the left was also in use. Troubleshooting guides suggested resetting the AirPods, reconnecting, testing on other devices, and etc., but nothing fixed the issue, and it was consistent throughout multiple devices (iPhone, iPad, PC). I ended up returning these and requesting a replacement.The second pair I received, which is the one I currently own, worked fine for the first couple weeks. However, the issue from the previous pair started occurring with these as well. I decided to keep these despite the problem because unlike the first set, these seemed to function properly at least sometimes, so they weren’t consistently dysfunctional. Resetting the AirPods also temporarily resolves the issue, but this isn’t the most convenient thing to do when it 1. happens rather frequently (pretty much daily) and 2. I have a case, and you need to hold onto the button on the back of the charging case to reset/reconnect. Also, weirdly enough, this pair had the connection issues with both AirPods. Sometimes the right wouldn’t work without the left, and other times the left wouldn’t work without the right. It’s probably a weird coincidence, but it always seems like the one I want to use at any given moment is the earbud that doesn’t want to connect without the other.Anyway, I kept the second pair because they were functioning well enough, and I had purchased them for $99 which I guess isn’t too awful for brand new and legitimate Apple AirPods. But if the price was higher and I knew about this connectivity issue, which seems to be rather common judging from all the troubleshooting forums I found, I probably wouldn’t make the purchase.
