reviewTitle: Seamless integration with your Apple devices
reviewDescription: The 2nd Gen AirPods sound crisp and clear. The bass is at the right level and doesn’t sound distorted at all like some earbuds. Where they really shine as some reviewers have pointed out is in their seamless integration with Apple products. Say you are using your iPhone and decide to do something on the iPad. By just picking up your iPad the AirPods will connect to it. All of this happens without you having to do anything besides picking up your device. It’s also easy to keep track of battery life. Opening the case displays a 3D image of pods and case with the battery status of each on your iPhone’s screen. If you happen to misplace your AirPods you can use the Find My app to locate them. You can play a sound on each pod if they’re outside the case but it isn’t that loud so I’m not sure how useful this would be in practice. One of things I like is that I can still hear my surroundings when they’re in. With the volume at the right level it’s possible to hold a conversation and listen to music too. So these aren’t noise cancelling. They’re a deal at $99. They’ve been out for a while but they’re still good.

The AirPods are incredibly easy to use and come with a charging case that talk about up to 24 hours of battery life. And I love the ability to use Siri hands-free, the AirPods make using your phone more convenient than ever before.One of the most impressive features of the AirPods that I also liked is their seamless integration with Apple devices. Once you've paired your AirPods with your iPhone, they'll automatically connect to any of your other Apple devices that are signed in to iCloud. This means you can listen to music on your MacBook, take a call on your iPad, and then return to your iPhone without ever having to manually switch your AirPods between devices.Another great thing about the AirPods is their sound quality. The AirPods deliver a clear and crisp audio experience, and the noise-canceling feature ensures you can enjoy your music or phone call without any outside interference. And with the new spatial audio feature, the AirPods provide a surround-sound experience that truly immerses you in your content.The design of the AirPods is sleek and modern, and they're incredibly comfortable to wear. The earbuds fit snugly in your ears and won't fall out, even during strenuous exercise. And because they're so small and lightweight, you'll hardly even notice you're wearing them.One of the few downsides to the AirPods is their price. They're not the cheapest wireless earbuds on the market, but the quality and convenience they offer make them well worth the investment. And because they're made by Apple, you can trust that they're built to last.Overall, the Apple AirPods are a fantastic product that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a high-quality wireless earbud experience. They're incredibly easy to use, offer great sound quality and noise-canceling capabilities, and have a comfortable and modern design. If you're an Apple user looking for a great pair of wireless earbuds, the AirPods are definitely worth considering.

I'm cheap. This was in large part why I resisted shelling out the money for these. Consequently, I tried several other Bluetooth earbuds, several on the decidedly cheap end of the scale. One of the problems I experience is finding earbuds that fit my ears. I have very small ear canals, so the earbuds that have the cone shape tip that fits into the ear canal either just won't fit, or are extremely painful after a short time. The only shape I've found that actually works for me are these, which I discovered with the first pair of wired Apple earbuds that came with a new iPhone several versions back.I included this picture, which shows the Airpods on the left and the much cheaper knock-off I tried. I thought I'd be okay with the shape of the cheap ones, but as you can see, they are actually much larger than the Airpods, so they were frequently falling out of my ears, especially when I was doing any physical activity.So, I bit the bullet and shelled out for the OGs. Here's my take:Pros:-Integration with other Apple products. I have an iPhone, iPad and Apple watch and these work quite seamlessly unlike any others I've tried. I put "almost" in the title because I'm sure it will be improved on in further versions, I'm just not sure how. Oh, and I've never used "Hey Siri" as much as I do with these. I love being able to adjust the volume (among other commands) hands free. True story: Yesterday I was riding a scooter home from work, and not wanting to remove either hand from the handlebars, I wanted to use Siri to increase the volume. There was enough ambient downtown noise that Siri was having trouble hearing me, so as I was tootling down the busy city street I was saying "Hey Siri" repeatedly at increasing volume, until I was shouting it. Not one of my finer moments...-The fit (see above)-Quick charging. I will have something to say about the battery life in Cons, but one saving grace is that they charge remarkably fast. I do a lot of work from my computer (like a lot of others during the time of COVID), so I appreciate being able to get a quick charge on them between meetings.-Sound quality. I am not an audiophile, so my opinion here is very pedestrian, but they seem to have a good dynamic range. I've been blown away by the bass response coming out of such a small thing.Cons:-They still are not very secure in my ears. I suppose that could be more my issue than the Airpods, but I did have to buy an aftermarket accessory kit that included the silicone tips with wings and a silicone lanyard. Sometimes I commute to work on an electric scooter, and if it weren't for those (particularly the lanyard) I would have dropped one of them in the street multiple times. Sometimes I walk over a grate in the street and have a brief moment of fear that one will pop out of my ear and through the grate. With my luck, it isn't so much an issue of "if", but "when". (Side Note: if Apple doesn't sell replacements individually, they should)-Battery life. I figure I get about 2 hours of active use, which is fine and I think what they advertise. The curious thing is that the two discharge at very different rates. I'm trying to keep track so I can take them into our local Apple store and ask about it, but it is odd, and I have seen other reviews that also noted that issue.Overall, I give them 2 thumbs up!
Love love love these the GPS isn’t great in this generation and the battery isn’t the best. But over all great AirPods for an affordable price.

Ever since I switched from Android and PC, I've become Apple-centric. Since Apple products like Apple products, I decided to buy some Air Pods. Amazon's Prime Day price of $114 finally brought them down to what I considered a little bit better price, so I bought them.Pros:1. They connect very quickly with all my Apple devices.2. The sound quality is a few steps above some of the other ear buds I've had. The stereo is good, and while they don't have enough bass for me, they don't sound tinny either.3. They fit fairly comfortably in my ears, although the right pod fits better that the left one does. Maybe I have an oddly-shaped left ear!4. So far, neither pod has fallen out of my ears. However, I've worn them mainly in the house, so I don't know how it would be if I was running. That, I'll never know because I don't run anywhere.5. The case opens very easily, and the pods are fairly easy to remove. I really appreciate this because my Jabra case is so hard to open that I would often have to get my husband to do it for me.6. I love, love, love the fact that I can say "Hey Siri," and get so many things done. I was watching an Amazon Prime show on my iPad Pro the other day, and I told Siri to mute the volume, and she did it! However, when I said to un mute, that didn't happen. Maybe I need to figure out some other terminology for that. When I said to rewind a couple of seconds, it did that, too. This is a really great feature.Cons:1. Other than the price, the one thing that kept me from buying these was how silly they look with that long white stem protruding out the ear. One person said they look like a hair dryer, and they do. I have noticed that the Air Pods Pro have a much shorter stem, and thus they look more normal. I guess when the get down low enough in price, I'll probably buy them and give these to a friend or relative.2. They don't have noise cancellation, which I would really love to have. I guess I'll have to wait for the Pros for that.3. I didn't realize that they had wired and wireless charging versions, and I ended up with the wired ones. However, I bought a wireless charging case for less than $10 from Amazon Warehouse, so I'm going to see if that works.Overall, other than some of the cons I mentioned, I really do like these. They connect quickly, have a pretty good sound, and the hands-free Siri feature is great. However, I would say that if you can afford them, you should get the Air Pods Pro because they look better, and they have more features. If you can't, these would be a great stop-gap measure until the Pros go down in price.

reviewTitle: Too many issues for the price
reviewDescription: Overall, sound is fine. They’re just earbuds so I don’t expect audiophile levels of sound quality or any noise cancellation. But for an apple product, these things have far too many bugs for their price.These things are terrible outdoors or in very large spaces. They will cutout and disconnect, because I’m assuming the signal is too weak and doesn’t have anything to bounce off of. That makes them basically useless for the outdoors or in wide open spaces, like large atriums or gyms. I can really only expect to use these in the home or office, which meant I had to buy another pair of headphones that worked outdoors. It’s a bit ridiculous.Speaking of home and office use, the mic does not work well at all, and is unusable for phone calls, video/zoom calls, etc. So again, I have to switch to a headset or my other pair of headphones for that, since people cannot hear me if I attempt to use these.On top of that, they also have issues with ear detection and randomly disconnecting from my iPhone. I’ll be wearing them, listening to whatever, and suddenly they just drop the connection, as if I took them out of my ear. The only way to get it working again is to place it back into the case and take them out again and place them back in your ear. It’s very annoying and happens almost every time I use them.I’ve used two pairs since 2018, and both have had these issues. I’ve only used them with other apple products, multiple iPhones and an iPad, so I know it’s not a device compatibility or Bluetooth issue.My oldest pair has almost no battery life left, and is only useable for less than an hour at a time, so don’t expect these things to last more than a few years either.In conclusion, these have always felt like a step backward from a classic pair of wired earbuds. Sure, they’re wireless, but it just feels so much less usable in so many different ways, while being 10 times the cost. Apple needs to seriously step up their wireless earbuds game if they insist on moving away from wired connections and forcing us to use the garbage pods.

reviewTitle: Still not up to the level of quality one would expect from a $140 pair of earbuds.
reviewDescription: I am comparing these to my ~$40 SoundPEATs Q29 model i bought 2-3 years ago.  Its almost as the the pros and cons for these two competing earbuds are reversed.Apple AirPod PROS:Battery Life: ~5 hrs listening time. And the case holds charge for, i don't even know how many charges. I haven't counted but its significantly higher than the SoundPEATS.Ease of Charging: SO SIMPLE. The magnet inside secures the airpods to the charging electrodes. The soundpeats lose their connection to the electrodes constantly so it never fully charges either earbud. I would have to constantly twerk and manipulate the buds in the case to make them charge.Ease of Connecting: The chip helps them connect without any problems.Audio Latency while watching video: NONE!!Custimization: Really like that you can customize the controls for either right or left AirPod. However, would like, more gestures I'd like to customize. Like, instead of just a 2 tap, also have a 3-tap. That way you can customize 4 controls. I'd really like to be able to repeat a song, or turn up and down the volume.Apple AirPod MEHS:Audio Quality: Just a little better than the SoundPEATs... not much but it is noticeable.Apple AirPod CONS:Connectivity: Because of the Apple's forced upgrading, we can't use these on devices running anything before iOS10. That means I can't connect to my First Gen iPad. (the thing is still chugging along and great for streaming NetFlix, Hulu, and Videos.Comfort: The SoundPEATs were super comfortable and fit snuggly in the ear. The shape of the AirPods bothers my earholes. I even purchased some vinyl condoms with earplugs to cover it up. It makes it more comfortable, but its still noticeably more uncomfortable. Also, those vinyl covers don't allow the AirPods to fit in the case, so I have to remove them all the time.... which isn't too bad since I ended having to do that with the SoundPEATS because I couldn't get them to charge properly with the earbud cushion? on.Look/Style: The AirPods look dumb as hell. The SoundPEATs are small and round and fit right in the ear and don't have a white wang hanging down over your earlobe.Dropped Connection/Choppy Audio: Ok. Here I was thinking that the AirPods would correct this issue with the SoundPEATs. When I'm oustide working in the yard, audio was choppy regardless if the phone was 10 feet away or in my pocket. Nothing I did seemed to correct it. It was like this with the SoundPEATS. I THOUGHT that the chip in the AirPods would keep this from happening. NOPE. SAME PROBLEM PERSISTED and was made worse by the fact that they were 3.5x more expensive!!!!!  Work fine in doors and while I'm at work in the lab. Must be some sort of interference outside. But really, Come on. Its 2019. GET IT TOGETHER.Exterior Audio: UGH The AirPods fail spectacularly here. Not only do they get choppy while I'm out doing yard work, but because they don't have a rubber tip that seals up the ear canal like the SoundPEATs, that means I get to hear the FULL sound of my lawnmower and weedwacker and it drowns out my jams. And also my nagging boss at work and rando plebians i come across in my travels. Also this means they will be practically useless on an airplane. The SoundPEATs helped block out the engine drone and crying and shouting babies, children, and MAGA douchenozzles.Overall, I like them enough to keep using them for regular use but I will need to go back to my SoundPeats for airplane travel and yardwork. Son of a....

reviewTitle: Great when you need to listen music and your environment
reviewDescription: Let's first start off with noise cancellation: It's non-existent. You WILL hear everything going on around you, with turning the volume up just damaging your ears. This is due to the AirPod kind of laying inside your ear, which doesn't create a seal as in earbuds with silicone tips. This not only kills any noise cancellation, but will cause sound to bleed to the outside when loud enough (say around 50%).The issues above are also benefits in environments like offices or schools. This is thanks to the lack of noise cancellation. With music playing, talking to someone sounds just the same as without them. In addition, without a seal being created in your ear, they have to be louder than usual, which they certainly are (Not by a huge margin, but a noticeable one). Now for the stem of the AirPods, they aren't just for show. The microphones in the stem help make calls sound clear and usable.The shape of the AirPods are a hit-or-miss. They'll either fit you or they won't. The best way you could test this is by trying on some EarPods, as they are pretty much AirPods with wires (design-wise). For me, they fit my ears, but start to slip off on their own. They don't fall, but they give me the sensation that they will. You can fix this with some rubber hooks that go on the AirPods to hold them in place inside your ears (You'll need to remove them when putting them back in their case though).The battery life is...fine. It's not abysmal and will last you a good while, but it's not anything to write home about. At least the pop-up when opening the case will remind you of charging them (On an iPhone, I don't think it'll do this on Android). It charges via lightning, but there is a version available with a wireless charging case if you'd like.Sound quality is good, but not perfect. Bass is not it's strong point, and some instruments do get muffled out on some tracks. Vocals can be heard well (which helps out on calls) though. Disclaimer: I'm not an audiophile, just a guy that listens to music for hours.Initial pairing is relatively simple on an iPhone/Mac, just open them while being close to your intended device. The AirPods connect nearly instant when taking them out of the case. While I can't speak for Android or Windows devices, I would assume that they would pair the same way as any other devices, but don't take my word for it.Also, there is no official water/sweat resistance to them. I haven't used them in these environments, but have heard stories of them surviving washing machines (Which I will not be testing). Take that with a grain of salt though.Overall, they are great earphones for me, but make sure you know what you need of your earphones first. If you make a lot of calls and want to hear everything around you, these are the ones to go for.
They work but it’s very quiet sometimes, I’m not sure if it’s just a me problem or what.

I recently got my hands on the AirPods 1, and I must say, they have exceeded my expectations in every possible way. From the moment I opened the sleek white charging case, I knew I was in for a treat. These truly wireless earbuds have become an indispensable part of my daily routine, and here's why they deserve a solid 5-star rating.First and foremost, the sound quality of the AirPods 1 is exceptional. The audio is crisp, clear, and well-balanced across the entire frequency range. Whether I'm listening to my favorite tracks or engaging in video calls, the AirPods deliver an immersive and satisfying listening experience. The bass response is surprisingly punchy, and the vocals are rendered with impressive clarity.Pairing the AirPods with my devices is an absolute breeze. The seamless integration with my iPhone, iPad, and MacBook is something to marvel at. The moment I open the case, they automatically connect to my device, allowing me to dive straight into my audio without any hassle. The connection is stable and reliable, ensuring uninterrupted playback even when I'm on the move.The design of the AirPods 1 is both elegant and practical. The sleek, minimalistic earbuds fit snugly in my ears, providing a comfortable and secure fit. I can wear them for hours without experiencing any discomfort. The lack of wires is liberating, allowing me to move freely without any tangles or restrictions. Additionally, the charging case is compact and pocket-friendly, making it convenient to carry the AirPods wherever I go.One of the standout features of the AirPods 1 is their battery life. The earbuds themselves can last for hours on a single charge, and the charging case provides multiple charges, extending the total usage time. This means I can enjoy my favorite music or podcasts throughout the day without worrying about running out of battery. When it's time to recharge, the Lightning connector ensures a quick and efficient charging experience.Lastly, the convenience of the AirPods 1 cannot be overstated. The built-in microphones allow for clear and hands-free calling, and the touch controls on the earbuds make it easy to adjust volume, skip tracks, and activate Siri without reaching for my phone. The smart sensors also automatically pause playback when I remove an earbud, which is a thoughtful feature that saves both battery life and playback progress.In conclusion, the AirPods 1 have proved to be a remarkable companion for my audio needs. With exceptional sound quality, effortless pairing, comfortable fit, and long-lasting battery life, they have truly earned their 5-star rating. If you're in search of a truly wireless listening experience that combines convenience, style, and superb audio quality, look no further than the AirPods 1.

I really want to like them. They're supposed to be effortlessly convenient to pair and use for all your Apple devices while sounding and looking good. But they're not....they're none of that. Let me explain:Sound - it's ok, really. No seal so you hear all the ambient noise around you which is good and bad depending on the situation. Not much for bass extension, treble is flat but clear. Adequate all things considered. If you've used the old design earpods, these are nearly the same sound profile. On a plus, the microphones are very good.Features - very little to say here. They're Bluetooth (5.0) so they pair quickly and have long range, when they work (more on that later).Battery Life - very good, a couple hours at high-ish volume on the pods and half a dozen charges per case charge. More than I need for most situations.Functionality - 100% atrocious and I've had 3 sets of these (shame on me). The case and charging system is so faulty it leads to numerous other problems with pairing and connecting both AirPods at the same time. The contact points in the case and on the pods where they charge easily loses connection, dirties, and later corrodes. Using them for fitness around any sweat or moisture will speed up their inevitable failure. Once this happens, one pod will refuse to charge or stay connected when put back in the case, draining it's battery or trying to reconnect to different devices when in the case. Even if they didn't suffer constant bugs, the pairing with multiple devices is equally buggy, frequently losing connection or trying to connect to other devices in the house for no apparent reason.As far as I can tell, AirPods Pro share the same charging design, so I will listen to my own advice and stay far away from these until the design is fixed. I would advise you do the same.

reviewTitle: May the odds be ever in your favor
reviewDescription: I was a little wary when ordering these and when I was unpacking the air pods. I first checked the serial number on the apple website and then it wanted me to associate it with my Apple ID. I took that as good news. Had no problem connecting to my iPhone 13 Max Pro.I started listen to music and it sounded fine. It was a bit different from my Samsung Buds I still have, but I was still optimistic.Things turned when I answered a call. The call kept going high and low where I can’t hear the other side but they could hear me. When I called, they could only hear me on speaker phone, like the previous call.I’m not sure if these are real, but these definitely are making me think if I actually need another pair anyways.
The right one doesn’t work at all and the case doesn’t stay charged. Complete waste of money.

I've always wanted AirPods but found the cost too expensive. I was really happy when I found these AirPods for cheaper and I found the double tap feature really convenient when I'm on the go. Unfortunately, I've experienced multiple issues with them.I often find the notification that my AirPods are connected when they're in the case and the case is closed. I thought it was because I was using an older phone, but I just got the new iPhone 13 and the issues persist. It's pretty annoying to have the notification because while it's at the top of my screen, I can't swipe down to access the notification bar, and it takes a while to go away. There was a time when I was playing music through the speaker and the music stopped because my phone said my AirPods had connected.I've also had issues with the double tap feature. There are times when my music pauses by itself and though my hair sometimes brushes against, I just don't think it can mimic a double tap. There are also times when the headphones won't respond to a double tap.Lastly, they die so quickly! I don't know if this is normal for all AirPods but it feels like I'm constantly having to charge them, whereas my other Bluetooth headphones can run for days on a single charge. I'm pretty bummed that these didn't work out.

My audio technica over ear headphones broke so I decided to buy something cheaper, figured I’d give these a go since I have an iPhone 13 Pro Max.PROS: I like the charging case. Battery life is great. They were extremely easy to link to my phone and the moment I pop them out of the case, they connect to my phone.CONS: they hurt my ears. I have small ears and they become painful after an hour so I’m not wearing them often and intend on upgrading to the AirPod pros in the future. A notification pops up on my Appletv whenever I’m nearby, which can interrupt my husband’s tv time.

reviewTitle: Honestly, I've had lots of problems with these
reviewDescription: First of all, 24 hours of battery life? That has never been true with the brand new AirPods I received. There have been many times I have had to reset or reboot my phone, try repeatedly to get the Airpods to connect to my iPhone 13 Pro Max or Macbook Pro. There have been several mornings when I found the Airpods dead - no battery, though they were plugged in all night. Today, I was on chat with Apple Support for nearly an hour because the Airpods show 100% battery but the case shows 0%, no matter how long it is plugged in. Then I use the Airpods and within 15 mins they make a noise as if they're almost out of battery. It's so frustrating. My only option now is to take them to an Apple store and see if their technical people can solve the problem. I bought these brand new last summer, and the problems started within 30 days. I almost returned them, but they started working again, and now they're frequently failing again.

These AirPods never worked right from the beginning as  they wouldn’t disconnect from the Bluetooth automatically,  thus always being dead. Once I would put them on either the left one would be dead or the right one would have no power!  annoying, foolishly , I purchased a two year warranty in which Apple did right by.
They die super fast and they aren’t great for phone calls. They dont hurt my ears as bad as the previous versions but they’re more sensitive then other pairs

I ordered these on prime day from Amazon. The pro was I received them within hours of ordering.The con, as with many name brand items on Amazon I’m not sure why the quality you get on Amazon is always so much different than what you get at actual large retailers but it’s always a different quality. One of the buds wouldn’t pair automatically nor did it make a sound letting me know it was connected. Troubleshot the pod with Amazon tech support and then it started working but the other went out. Long story short, purchase from Apple or target or maybe even Walmart.As for the pods themselves, I would recommend getting the pro. These are cute and stylish and you can listen to music or videos or whatever but there is zero noise cancellation. Like zero. I got them mainly for work so when I’m working I can tune out noise but absolutely no, I can hear everything around me. They fit well and the overall sound quality is good for what’s it’s worth but they are not the best by any means. They are convenient. I think the battery is pretty good. They stay in place. But if you’re looking for the best sound or noise cancelling, skip these. If you’re looking to save a little money but want a good quality Bluetooth earbud set by a trusted brand then get these. Don’t waste your money on the $20-40 no names cause they typically don’t fit well and have connectivity issues.

reviewTitle: To see if Apple honors if repair is needed.
reviewDescription: The AirPods work great.  Thank you.

The sound quality, like most apple headphones, is phenomenal. Though, if you're looking for noise cancelling, these are not the headphones for you.This works well for me though as I often wear them at work. I can listen to my music and podcasts, but can still hear if an alarm goes off or if someone starts talking to me.For me it has great battery life. I have yet to have the earbuds die while I'm using them -- the charging case is quite convenient.I started with the 3rd generation airpods (but I lost them at the airport), which has a more dynamic touch sensor (tap once to play/pause, tap twice to either skip backward or forward). These second generation headphones do not have a single touch option, so I have to click twice on the left ear to play/pause and twice on the right ear to skip forward. Meaning, you can only have two commands through the airpods, one for each ear, but you are able to set what you would like those to be. It makes no sense to me why an airpod can detect a double tap, but not a single tap?If you can afford it, I would get the 3rd generation airpods, which also have a surround sound feature. Since I need the lower price, these airpods work for me.They also have worked great for me while talking on the phone. I have difficulty when there are heavy winds (I live in the city and spend a lot of time walking outside), but otherwise the input and output quality is great on phone calls.They are compatible with most Bluetooth devices, so I use them with both my iPhone and my PC.
Got them cuz the price went down.

reviewTitle: If it walks like a duck and quacks like a duck...
reviewDescription: I have never owned a pair of apple airpods before so I have nothing to base my purchase on. But I purchased these on Amazon for ninety nine bucks and the apple site sells these for one hundred twenty-nine bucks.I checked to see if the serial number checks out on the apple support site. It did identify as 2nd gen airpods but stated it could not validate my purchase date. That doesn't prove much.The airpods seem to pass the sniff test on my bluetooth settings.My box states that it was assembled in Vietnam. I checked online and it states that it should say "Assembled in China" for some and other sources state that "Assembled in Vietnam" is fine.When I connect the airpods to my iphone, it does offer me 6 months of apple music. If they were fake, I don't think offer would be available to me.I do notice fast battery life. The moment I take them off the charger and begin using them, I notice them turning to 99% full in about 5 minutes without any use - just wearing them in my. ears. The sound is not what I would expect from Apple - some crackling noises but maybe I'm just nitpicking. The sound on music is pretty good. When I'm cranking the volume all the way and listening to music, people can hear it from 3 feet away in a quiet room. When using bluetooth on calls, I'm told that my voice is coming crystal clear.Everything I checked seems to check out and these are real 2nd gen airpods but my skeptical mind tells me these are really really good fakes.In any case, these were a hundred bucks and work pretty good. I will enjoy these.

reviewTitle: Item Defective. Scam. Buy Them Locally.
reviewDescription: Just got my AirPods delivered today. Over $100 after tax. Was excited to open them. Got them opened and connected to my device, everything seemed fine. That was until the left AirPod did not work. My device shows battery percentage for both the right AirPod and the AirPod case. There is no battery level for the left AirPod. When the left AirPod is inserted into the case, my device indicates that it is charging. When removed from the case, the left AirPod shows no battery percentage or any type of icon under the image of the left AirPod for that matter. These have become part of my daily routine more than just a tech accessory have become an integral part of my daily routine. The simplicity of setup, where they seamlessly connect with my devices, has made them my go-to audio companion. What stands out beyond the technicalities is the immersive experience they provide, powered by the Apple H1 headphone chip. Whether it's losing myself in a podcast during a morning jog or catching up on my favorite tunes while cooking, the high-quality sound never fails to impress. The "Hey Siri" feature has made me feel like I'm in the future, and the fact that they intuitively pause when taken out of my ears is a small yet delightful touch. The 24-hour battery life is a real game-changer, and the ability to share audio with another set of AirPods makes them a versatile tool for both solitude and shared moments.

reviewTitle: Terrible product support with unrealistic expectations of customers
reviewDescription: My wife purchased these for me as a gift in August 2020 and they worked great up until about a month ago.  At that time, the right ear bud microphone began to fail and would no longer detect sound unless I was yelling.  I contacted customer support at Apple and worked through all of the potential resolutions such as updating to the newest iOS (14.6) and confirming that the AirPods were running the most recent firmware.  When customer support was not able to resolve the issue they suggested that I send the AirPods in for repair.  I received a shipping box and label for FedEx and sent them offer for repair.  The AirPods arrived back at my home about 3 days later with a note from the technicians stating that there was nothing wrong with them.  I then tested them again on my phone and my wife's phone, and with both phones the right microphone would only detect sound at a loud volume (i.e. yelling) and yet still garbled.  Again I contacted customer support at Apple.  This time the agent suggested that the next step would be to take the AirPods to the nearest Apple Store so that I could demonstrate the issue for a technician there.  Unfortunately the nearest Apple Store is 2.5 hours from my home, though this did not seem to be an inconvenience in the eyes of the agent.  At this point, I stated that it did not make sense to drive 5 hours round-trip to repair a $130 device, and I questioned why I could not send them back for repair while identifying the exact issue.  The agent agreed to send another shipping box and to include on the repair "ticket" that the issue was with the right microphone.  So... (can you guess where this is going?) I received another box, sent the AirPods a 2nd time for repair, and waited.  Again, they returned them to me and stated that nothing was wrong with them.  And again, the right microphone still does not function correctly.  At this point I am left wondering why the "World's Most Valuable Company" would find it acceptable to ask a customer to take 5 hours of his/her time to fix Apple's product, instead of simply sending a replacement pair and keeping the customer happy.  Apple's product support has ruined what could be a great product.

reviewTitle: At first I really liked them but then I noticed some flaws
reviewDescription: ***I DO NOT BELIEVE THESE TO BE REAL APPLE AIRPODS - I HONESTLY THINK THEY ARE FAKE********IT HAS ALWAYS CONFOUNDED ME THAT THERE IS NO STATUS LIGHT ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE CASE - TO DETERMINE IF THEY ARE CHARGING I HAVE TO OPEN THE CASE. They are not inexpensive. I think I got the cheapest pair and that comes with a wired charging case and really not that impressive of features or sound quality. reviewTitle: Will only stay in your ear if your head remains motionless
reviewDescription: The sound is great, the battery life is great. But, I got these for the purpose of indoor workouts such as on a treadmill or indoor bicycle trainer. A couple of steps on the treadmill or a couple of cranks on your pedals and they pop right out of your ears. I even purchased the ear clips and they will prevent the AirPods from falling onto to ground but the moment the earbuds move one mm away from your ear canal the connection with your iPhone is lost and the music or podcast shuts off. While I'm working out I do not have time to constantly fight with these things to try to keep them attached to my ears. The bottom line is unless you plan to use these only while sitting motionless sitting on the couch don't waste your money on them. Even if you start chewing on something they will almost immediately pop out of your ears.

reviewTitle: Volume reduction issue & terrible customer support
reviewDescription: These air pods lasted me less than 6 months. The left AirPod volume was significantly reduced (only playing at around 20% compared with right). I read about this issue on other reviews. Apple initially said it would honor the warranty but when I sent them back, they said they found evidence of water damage causing corrosion to where the AirPods connect in the case. I use the AirPods for jogging so the only thing I can think of is sweat that caused “water damage”. They have never been in or near water. Additionally, they charged just fine so that wasn’t even the issue. They refused to fix the damaged speaker issue because of this “evidence of water damage”.Do not use these AirPods for exercise because apparently they will corrode and the hardware obviously isn’t very good after only ~6 months of use. Apple customer support was extremely disappointing and a huge waste of time.

The Bluetooth is very fickle and doesn't always do what I want it to do, when I want it done. Frustrating! When I want reliability, to be heard clearly and no problems, I go back to using my wired earbuds! Again, I wish I could return those, but my window of opportunity has passed!

My left AirPod works fine but my right one want even connect. I have tried to reconnect multiple times and it want work. The only reason I didn’t send them back was because I always just put one in my ear anyways but it would have been nice for both of them to work since we paid for them.

reviewTitle: Doesn't fit for everyone and gets lost easily
reviewDescription: When i bought this product i was sure i found the best possible Bluetooth headset.Now after having it for few months already (or rather say not having it for few month) i can voice my opinion clearly.These peered well with my phone, and You can hear well in it too. But here comes the downside of this:A-It doesn't fit well in my ear. Gets my ear itchy with the feeling of my ear needs to breath :). I need to take it off in middle of a call for a few minutes because of comfort.How can a one shaped earbud fit universally into everyone's ear??????? It doesn't have the soft pieces in the end which makes it flexible fit in the ear customized to your ear shape.As a side note, I purchased clips to hold these around my ear. They helped somewhat.B-It is so small which looks cool on the ear but gets lost so fast. Only if you have the apple phone or device with it you can have the app which locates it in case it gets lost.This is the other downside of it.C-It doesn't cancel out noise well. When washing dishes I would rather use a cheap round the ear headset because with these the other person on the other side of the line would hear the water running and I would come in very not clear.
Extremely uncomfortable. Pop out of case and get lost. Not easy on plane. Continually fall out of ears. Eating or drinking causes them to fall out.Sound is good.

I have been using headphones with my iPhone for quite some time now, but I was looking for a wire-free option that would allow me to listen to anything without disturbing others. That's when I came across the "2nd Generation Apple AirPods" and found them to be the perfect fit for me. I love their sleek design and how easy they are to set up. The lightning charging case ensures they are always ready to go, and the Bluetooth connectivity is seamless. They provide comfort and a secure fit for any activity. Nowadays, they are affordable. If you're looking for a wireless audio solution, then the AirPods are definitely worth considering!

I've been using my AirPods for about a month and a half now and they have been amazing so far! I love that they are light weight and that the sound quality is incredible. I will admit that I wish the battery lasted a little longer, but I do tend to listen to music non-stop for hours on end so it makes sense that I drain the battery pretty fast on them. Other than that they are perfect! Definitely worth purchasing if you own an Apple device, it makes your listening experience so much better than using other brands. I'm definitely happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle: Holly Mother of all that is good and loud
reviewDescription: Would like to start by saying that I am an Android girl through and through.Never have I ever purchased ANYTHING Apple because I never liked Steve Jobs or his policies and products.With my newest job however came this Apple iPhone (yuck lol). Didn't have an option so had to learn how to use it.  Kept my personal Samsung.On a business trip though, my friend - fellow Android lover lol - needed to get on a conference call and - to my horror - took out a pair of Air Pods  and put them on ... my mouth was hanging open. How dare he, first of all, but then how did the Air Pod pair with the Samsung phone !?!Meanwhile I am sitting there with my stupid iPhone in hand and a pair of Beats ear buds, they paired no issues.But I am intrigued by his Air Pods.  He says these are awesome. ... and I figured okay, I'll make a once in a life time exception and get a pair.OH MY GOD my friends! The sounds in these is phenomenal. Cannot be described in any other way than - it flows like honey - lava - it immerses you in whatever it is you're listening to.I have spent the past few weeks listening to every melody, music, classical concert I have loved my entire life and they sound magnificent ! Beethoven, Tchaikovsky, Grieg.  And Nina Simone, Despacito, Elvis, rap, blues, soul. You name it it sounds amazing. Fluid. Silky. Cashmere. Not enough epithets to describe.Not to mention they are silly comfortable, I have very small ears and nothing sits well, but these do!As a last note I still hate my iPhone (LOL) but LOVE my Air Pods. Ordered another pair so I can have one for my work phone and one for my personal wonderful Samsung Galaxy 😜.Buy these people! Worth every penny.

My wife and I both have the Apple Air pods (2 generation). I am a Truck Driver, so I go all kinds of roads, tunnels and cities. Also go inside of warehouses never loose connection. They turn on as soon as they touch your ear. you can hear the beep. Talk time is around 3 hours on full charge. they also beep when they are down to 10 percent of battery left. Very easy to charge just put them back into case after a few minutes they are up to 75 % charged. To charge the case just use your I phone charger. You have to charge the case about every 3 pod charges. My wife uses hers for walking and around the house. They don't fall out will walking outside or the treadmill. She charges hers about twice a week. (the case that is). The price is great on these. You can even get them on sale sometimes. You can also use 1 pod or both. Easy to connect to I phone. Just turn them on the Bluetooth will find them. you can also be about 100 feet away from phone and they are still connected. Will buy again. but if i find the #rd generation on sale that we cannot turn down would like to try them.

reviewTitle: Just as imagined! Thrilled to find for sale!
reviewDescription: New set of 2nd gen AirPods out of package work much were more quick to connect and play. Look and sound great and new. Charging case and pod, appear new. Charging as expected. I am happy to be able to replace my older set which lost persistent connectivity after many years of use and unintended abuse. Price was terrific in my  view, too!

These lasted me soo long until I lost them but, they accidentally went through the washer and dryer over 6 times, even came out of the case and the individual AirPods were floating inside and still worked perfectly, I even debated on taking them in the shower, but never have. I know they can be different for you everyone and I’m not recommending you put the in the washer but I’m suprised they still worked.

reviewTitle: Sound is on par with audiophile gear
reviewDescription: This is my second pair of AirPods pro. This new generation has an extra size for your ears, but I can't say they fit any better than the older ones. The noise cancel is phenomenal, and I like the way it detects when you're speaking to someone; it will moderate the amount of noise cancellation during your conversation. The sound is just fine, really fine. I have a $1600 pair of IEM's that I love, but I still enjoy listening to the AirPods for the convenience and the wonderful sound. The Dolby Atmos, spatialized sound is fantastic!

reviewTitle: This is the only review that matters
reviewDescription: I have bought 5 different pairs of these air pods. They are single handedly the best bang for your buck. If you manage to not lose them they should last you at least a year. Apple I do not care for your phones or anything else but if you ever stop making my second gen airpods I will have to start an up rising to burn down the cult that is apple. Till then I love you 😘

reviewTitle: So far so good and a great improvement over my old ones
reviewDescription: I previously had a pair of SimpTronic earbuds and these are much better for me personally.  The Simptronic ones had a poorer sound quality, fell out of my ears, and made my ears itch.These Apple earbuds hang in your ears making them more stable.  They do not have a foam cover so no itching.  And the sound quality is far superior.  They also have the stop feature by tapping; my Simptronic ones did not.  Just all around a better product.

reviewTitle: Decent for the price, sound quality is decent but not the best.
reviewDescription: Fitment depends on the person, I gave these as a gift to my GF as she wanted AirPods I’m not too big on the design as a user of Galaxy Buds as a comparison.  I do use an Apple iPhone but I don’t like the AirPods fitment in my ears. It fits her ears fine, but I just feel AirPods are overrated and there is better options out there for less money.

I recently snagged the Apple AirPods (2nd Gen), and I'm hooked. The unboxing experience was quintessentially Apple – sleek and satisfying. Pairing was a cinch, and the seamless integration with my iPhone made me feel like I was living in the future.What struck me first was the fit. Unlike previous earbuds, these babies stay put, whether I'm jogging or lost in music. The touch controls are a game-changer, making playback, calls, and Siri commands a breeze.Now, let's talk sound. The audio quality is top-notch. Crisp highs, deep lows, and a balanced mix that turns my everyday playlist into a private concert. Battery life is impressive, and the compact charging case slips into my pocket effortlessly.Sure, they're a bit pricey, but the AirPods' seamless Apple ecosystem integration and unparalleled audio quality make them worth every penny. These little pods have become my daily sidekick, turning mundane moments into a sonic adventure.

Eran los que iba buscando puesto que son los que mejor se adaptan a mis orejas. Excelente calidad - precio (los compré en Black Friday con un precio muy competitivo). Muchas horas de autonomía y se escuchan genial.
I prefer these because of no ear inserts.  I don’t like the feeling of my ear canal sealed.  These are great

reviewTitle: I tried, but these are the only ear phones for me.
reviewDescription: My left Airpod died after 2.5 years.  I tried the Ear Candy Dime ear pods, but they just sounded so hollow compared to what I'm use to. I hate spending the money, but I love the sound.  I've always been an Apple girl though.  The products are just easy for someone like me that has no patience for trying to figure out how things work.  Connect them, and put them in your ears.  Done.
I didn’t have a full week to experience it but after trying it right now it seems good and has nice sound quality

reviewTitle: My favorite headphones of all time
reviewDescription: I’ve been buying these specific headphones since they came out. They are so lightweight I forget that I’m wearing them. I wear them most of the day and I’ve never had them fall out. The have a long lasting charge and when they do die they recharge quickly.
Premium sound quality and great range. Great value for the money.Very light, perfect for hands-free calling and stay in the ear well.
I really like these AirPods because they sit perfectly in your ears especially if you have small ear canal. The sound is perfect!

I’ve spent a lot of money buy cheap knock off ear pods and finally caved and bought these AirPods. I should have saved my money and just bought them from the start! They fit perfect in my ears, which was something I struggled with from others. They stay in when I move around and the sound quality is top notch.

these are good everyday headphones! I wouldnt say theyre perfect for noise cancelling, or that they get super loud. I use them for walks, working out at the gym, or going on runs and they get the job done. also much easier to get them shipped to me in one day rather than go to a store!

This marks the THIRD set of Airpods I've gone through in just this year, all purchased from Amazon, and it's becoming quite a frustrating experience. I truly appreciate the convenience of Airpods, as they eliminate the hassle of tangled wires, but given their price point of $100, my expectations for their durability are much higher. I expect these to last at the very least a year, not a couple months.The recurring issue I've encountered is a drop in sound quality in one of the Airpods, rendering one fully functional while the other falls short. It's important to note that replacing a single Airpod costs almost as much as buying a brand new pair. This has become more than just a minor inconvenience. Not to mention, unless you have Apple Care, Amazon is very strict on not giving out replacements so I essentially wasted over $300 spent on Airpods that stopped working within just a couple months!!Apple, please improve the longevity and reliability of your products.

These are replacement AirPods. This is the second time I lost my AirPods but this time I never found them. Both times the find my wasn’t helpful. So it seems ridiculous to have to pair the AirPods with an AirTag. But this is typical Apple behavior so I should not be surprised. Amazon package arrived a day earlier than expected. Works well otherwise.

Bought these “for” my dad because his last pair finally went bad. They appear brand new, look clean sound good, but when I went into their settings it shows the name Martha and the warranty is only til October. Kind of weird and going to look into if we should swap these out.

reviewTitle: my sound faded out after a year
reviewDescription: i got these and they worked perfectly for about a year but then i left them at my sisters house for a while but when i got them back when im listening to music everyone says that they can hear it too this never used to happen unless i had it full volume

The headphones are good. I feel like they sre louder than beats but other than that they do die quickly. As they say they last 24+ hours but really mines last at most 8 hours and have to recharge them  2-3 times a day. While my beats last about a week

I have a terrible time keeping these in my ears.  I haven’t lost them yet, but am so worried I will.  The battery life sucks.  Only lasts about four hours and I’m not even talking on the phone or listening to music.
If you have an iPhone these are great. They do not fit great in my ears and took me a while to get used to. I hear gen 3 are more comfortable but these were cheaper. Battery life is great
They are very loud, clean, and brand new like. i highly recommend. price is hard to beat! battery life is as expected due to them being an older generation but they charge very quickly

reviewTitle: They would not stay in my ears
reviewDescription: I loved how the paired and worked seamlessly with all Apple devices!  Awesome sound!  But they constantly fell out of my ears. That’s why I gave them 3 stars.

Reseñar que son muy cómodos , no salen de las orejas, excelente cancelación de ruido en llamadas y videos etc. Solo señalar que el tiempo de duración de cada auricular es de solamente 1hora. Agrego que luego de unas semanas de uso y antes del mes de comprado comencé a notar que la carga tiene algún problema . Devolverlos se hace complicado intentaré una solución .

I bought two pairs as a personal upgrade and a birthday gift for my wife, and was very disappointed to realize quickly that the sound quality was essentially no better and the battery life, and most importantly, the flexibility of the controls were considerably less than my previous pair that are a fraction of the cost. The second pair was a gift, so I waited a few weeks for her birthday to try them, and immediately wanted to return them only to find that I had missed a TWO WEEK RETURN WINDOW.  I normally have had nothing but positive experiences with Amazon, but this was very, very disappointing.

I purchased the law AirPods bc the last 2nd generation has lasted me years and fit perfectly in my ears. Unfortunately, I’ve had these AirPods for only 4 days and the case will not hold a charge. Will be returning and trying my luck with purchasing from Target instead. I knew the quality of these AirPods would be wry hit or miss based on previous comments so I would purchase with caution.

reviewTitle: Great headphones…. For one year until one AirPods inevitably breaks
reviewDescription: I love these AirPods, but this is the SECOND PAIR of 2nd generation airpods I’ve had where one AirPod just stops working. Both times, this occurred right after my one year mark and right after my warranty expired. My first AirPod started having poor sound quality out of nowhere, while the second pair had the same issue while also having mic quality issues where I can’t use it to speak in the phone. I’m both cases, Apple did not help me to replace the AirPods, even after the second pair of AirPods shocked the inside of my ear while running.All this being said, ear hds do get damaged and I won’t claim to not ever drop them. However, the fact that two pairs of AirPods stopped working exactly a year later, right when the warranty ends, doesn’t sit well with me. As much as I love these AirPods, I can’t bring myself to buy them again….

The product worked for a couple weeks then started having issues with the left airpod. It would unpaired shortly after the return expiration date the left airpod wouldn't connect anymore. It's an okay product but the material feels cheap. Won't purchase again.

reviewTitle: The feel cheap and aren't that great for the price
reviewDescription: They just feel kinda cheap and honestly don't sound that great compared to cheaper wireless earbuds. Honestly if they weren't an apple product nobody would be buying these they would buy something for less and for better.

I ordered these airpods in April and they have already stopped working. I realize they are reconditioned but I would have though that they would last longer than 5 months. They don't charge, there is no longer a light on to even show the charge, and one of them consistently doesn't get any volume. I can't even charge them now. So frustrating.

reviewTitle: Worked fine for 2 weeks and now it’s not charging
reviewDescription: I like how light the AirPods are and they fit my ears pretty nicely, they were comfortable and completely fine until after like 2 weeks after using them, the case stopped charging haven’t been able to use them ever since and I can’t return them since the return for these is only a 2 week window instead of a full month.

reviewTitle: Right Airpod FINALLY Flew Away Forever
reviewDescription: Haven’t had these for 4 months yet. From the beginning, the right airpod was falling out of my ear. It finally fell out of my ear and down into the train station tracks about 20 minutes ago. One hundred dollars plus, GONE. I should be able to get partial refund. About to contact customer service. Will update only if successful.

These things are clunky and not worth the savings for the younger generation.  They do not fit snug.And after returning them my return status still shows they have not received the item yet the tracking number shows they were delivered back 3 days ago.  No one to contact, just hope my $$ is refunded.

reviewTitle: Don’t waste your money- get some nice wired earbuds
reviewDescription: At first I was ecstatic about my new airpods- they were amazing. There when I needed them; always charged and they fit in my ear perfectly. As time moved on the first thing I noticed was that they weren’t fitting in my ears like they used to. They continue to fall out. Then I noticed the battery life declining at a quicker rate than usual. Now my airpods suck. They are absolutely horrible.
